method.name: indexOf
method.description: Checks whether or not the specified object exists in the array.

parameter.name: o
parameter.description: The object to check for

method.name: remove
method.description: Removes the specified object from the array. If the object is not found nothing happens.

parameter.name: o
parameter.description: The object to remove

class.description:
The date parsing and format syntax is a subset of PHP's date() function, and the formats that are supported will provide results equivalent to their PHP versions. The following is a list of all currently supported formats: 
Format  Description                                                               Example returned values
------  -----------------------------------------------------------------------   -----------------------
  d     Day of the month, 2 digits with leading zeros                             01 to 31
  D     A short textual representation of the day of the week                     Mon to Sun
  j     Day of the month without leading zeros                                    1 to 31
  l     A full textual representation of the day of the week                      Sunday to Saturday
  N     ISO-8601 numeric representation of the day of the week                    1 (for Monday) through 7 (for Sunday)
  S     English ordinal suffix for the day of the month, 2 characters             st, nd, rd or th. Works well with j
  w     Numeric representation of the day of the week                             0 (for Sunday) to 6 (for Saturday)
  z     The day of the year (starting from 0)                                     0 to 364 (365 in leap years)
  W     ISO-8601 week number of year, weeks starting on Monday                    01 to 53
  F     A full textual representation of a month, such as January or March        January to December
  m     Numeric representation of a month, with leading zeros                     01 to 12
  M     A short textual representation of a month                                 Jan to Dec
  n     Numeric representation of a month, without leading zeros                  1 to 12
  t     Number of days in the given month                                         28 to 31
  L     Whether it's a leap year                                                  1 if it is a leap year, 0 otherwise.
  o     ISO-8601 year number (identical to (Y), but if the ISO week number (W)    Examples: 1998 or 2004
        belongs to the previous or next year, that year is used instead)
  Y     A full numeric representation of a year, 4 digits                         Examples: 1999 or 2003
  y     A two digit representation of a year                                      Examples: 99 or 03
  a     Lowercase Ante meridiem and Post meridiem                                 am or pm
  A     Uppercase Ante meridiem and Post meridiem                                 AM or PM
  g     12-hour format of an hour without leading zeros                           1 to 12
  G     24-hour format of an hour without leading zeros                           0 to 23
  h     12-hour format of an hour with leading zeros                              01 to 12
  H     24-hour format of an hour with leading zeros                              00 to 23
  i     Minutes, with leading zeros                                               00 to 59
  s     Seconds, with leading zeros                                               00 to 59
  u     Milliseconds, with leading zeroes (arbitrary number of digits allowed)    Examples:
                                                                                  001 (i.e. 1ms) or
                                                                                  100 (i.e. 100ms) or
                                                                                  999 (i.e. 999ms) or
                                                                                  999876543210 (i.e. 999.876543210ms)
  O     Difference to Greenwich time (GMT) in hours and minutes                   Example: +1030
  P     Difference to Greenwich time (GMT) with colon between hours and minutes   Example: -08:00
  T     Timezone abbreviation of the machine running the code                     Examples: EST, MDT, PDT ...
  Z     Timezone offset in seconds (negative if west of UTC, positive if east)    -43200 to 50400
  c     ISO 8601 date (note: milliseconds, if present, must be specified with     Examples:
        at least 1 digit. There is no limit to how many digits the millisecond    2007-04-17T15:19:21+08:00 or
        value may contain. see http://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime for more info)  2008-03-16T16:18:22Z or
                                                                                  2009-02-15T17:17:23.9+01:00 or
                                                                                  2010-01-14T18:16:24,999876543-07:00
  U     Seconds since the Unix Epoch (January 1 1970 00:00:00 GMT)                1193432466 or -2138434463
Example usage (note that you must escape format specifiers with '\\' to render them as character literals): 
// Sample date:
// 'Wed Jan 10 2007 15:05:01 GMT-0600 (Central Standard Time)'

var dt = new Date('1/10/2007 03:05:01 PM GMT-0600');
document.write(dt.format('Y-m-d'));                           // 2007-01-10
document.write(dt.format('F j, Y, g:i a'));                   // January 10, 2007, 3:05 pm
document.write(dt.format('l, \\t\\he jS \\of F Y h:i:s A'));  // Wednesday, the 10th of January 2007 03:05:01 PM
Here are some standard date/time patterns that you might find helpful. They are not part of the source of Date.js, but to use them you can simply copy this block of code into any script that is included after Date.js and they will also become globally available on the Date object. Feel free to add or remove patterns as needed in your code. 
Date.patterns = {
    ISO8601Long:"Y-m-d H:i:s",
    ISO8601Short:"Y-m-d",
    ShortDate: "n/j/Y",
    LongDate: "l, F d, Y",
    FullDateTime: "l, F d, Y g:i:s A",
    MonthDay: "F d",
    ShortTime: "g:i A",
    LongTime: "g:i:s A",
    SortableDateTime: "Y-m-d\\TH:i:s",
    UniversalSortableDateTime: "Y-m-d H:i:sO",
    YearMonth: "F, Y"
};
Example usage: 
var dt = new Date();
document.write(dt.format(Date.patterns.ShortDate));

property.name: MILLI
property.description: <static> Date interval constant

property.name: SECOND
property.description: <static> Date interval constant

property.name: MINUTE
property.description: <static> Date interval constant

property.name: HOUR
property.description: <static> Date interval constant

property.name: DAY
property.description: <static> Date interval constant

property.name: MONTH
property.description: <static> Date interval constant

property.name: YEAR
property.description: <static> Date interval constant

property.name: dayNames
property.description:
<static> An array of textual day names. Override these values for international dates. Example: 
Date.dayNames = [
      'SundayInYourLang',
      'MondayInYourLang',
      ...
    ];

property.name: monthNames
property.description:
<static> An array of textual month names. Override these values for international dates. Example: 
Date.monthNames = [
      'JanInYourLang',
      'FebInYourLang',
      ...
    ];

property.name: monthNumbers
property.description:
<static> An object hash of zero-based javascript month numbers (with short month names as keys. note: keys are case-sensitive). Override these values for international dates. Example: 
Date.monthNumbers = {
      'ShortJanNameInYourLang':0,
      'ShortFebNameInYourLang':1,
      ...
    };

property.name: formatCodes
property.description:
<static> The base format-code to formatting-function hashmap used by the format method. Formatting functions are strings (or functions which return strings) which will return the appropriate value when evaluated in the context of the Date object from which the format method is called. Add to / override these mappings for custom date formatting. Note: Date.format() treats characters as literals if an appropriate mapping cannot be found. Example: 
Date.formatCodes.x = "String.leftPad(this.getDate(), 2, '0')";
    (new Date()).format("X"); // returns the current day of the month

method.name: getShortMonthName
method.description: <static> Get the short month name for the given month number. Override this function for international dates.

parameter.name: month
parameter.description: A zero-based javascript month number.

method.name: getShortDayName
method.description: <static> Get the short day name for the given day number. Override this function for international dates.

parameter.name: day
parameter.description: A zero-based javascript day number.

method.name: getMonthNumber
method.description: <static> Get the zero-based javascript month number for the given short/full month name. Override this function for international dates.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The short/full month name.

method.name: parseDate

parameter.name: input
parameter.description: The unparsed date as a string.

parameter.name: format
parameter.description: The format the date is in.

method.name: getTimezone
method.description: Get the timezone abbreviation of the current date (equivalent to the format specifier 'T'). Note: The date string returned by the javascript Date object's toString() method varies between browsers (e.g. FF vs IE) and system region settings (e.g. IE in Asia vs IE in America). For a given date string e.g. "Thu Oct 25 2007 22:55:35 GMT+0800 (Malay Peninsula Standard Time)", getTimezone() first tries to get the timezone abbreviation from between a pair of parentheses (which may or may not be present), failing which it proceeds to get the timezone abbreviation from the GMT offset portion of the date string.

method.name: getGMTOffset
method.description: Get the offset from GMT of the current date (equivalent to the format specifier 'O').

parameter.name: colon
parameter.description: true to separate the hours and minutes with a colon (defaults to false).

method.name: getDayOfYear
method.description: Get the numeric day number of the year, adjusted for leap year.

method.name: getWeekOfYear
method.description: Get the numeric ISO-8601 week number of the year. (equivalent to the format specifier 'W', but without a leading zero).

method.name: isLeapYear
method.description: Whether or not the current date is in a leap year.

method.name: getFirstDayOfMonth
method.description:
Get the first day of the current month, adjusted for leap year. The returned value is the numeric day index within the week (0-6) which can be used in conjunction with the monthNames array to retrieve the textual day name. Example: 
var dt = new Date('1/10/2007');
    document.write(Date.dayNames[dt.getFirstDayOfMonth()]); //output: 'Monday'

method.name: getLastDayOfMonth
method.description:
Get the last day of the current month, adjusted for leap year. The returned value is the numeric day index within the week (0-6) which can be used in conjunction with the monthNames array to retrieve the textual day name. Example: 
var dt = new Date('1/10/2007');
    document.write(Date.dayNames[dt.getLastDayOfMonth()]); //output: 'Wednesday'

method.name: getFirstDateOfMonth
method.description: Get the date of the first day of the month in which this date resides.

method.name: getLastDateOfMonth
method.description: Get the date of the last day of the month in which this date resides.

method.name: getDaysInMonth
method.description: Get the number of days in the current month, adjusted for leap year.

method.name: getSuffix
method.description: Get the English ordinal suffix of the current day (equivalent to the format specifier 'S').

method.name: clone
clearTime
method.description: Clears any time information from this date.

parameter.name: clone
parameter.description: true to create a clone of this date, clear the time and return it (defaults to false).

method.name: add

parameter.name: interval
parameter.description: A valid date interval enum value.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The amount to add to the current date.

method.name: between
method.description: Checks if this date falls on or between the given start and end dates.

parameter.name: start
parameter.description: Start date

parameter.name: end
parameter.description: End date

method.name: format
method.description: Formats a date given the supplied format string.

parameter.name: format
parameter.description: The format string.

method.name: getElapsed
method.description: Returns the number of milliseconds between this date and date

parameter.name: date
parameter.description: (optional) Defaults to now

class.description:
Ext core utilities and functions.

This class is a singleton and cannot be created directly.

property.name: isStrict
property.description: True if the browser is in strict (standards-compliant) mode, as opposed to quirks mode

property.name: isSecure
property.description: True if the page is running over SSL

property.name: isReady
property.description: True when the document is fully initialized and ready for action

property.name: enableGarbageCollector
property.description: True to automatically uncache orphaned Ext.Elements periodically (defaults to true)

property.name: enableListenerCollection
property.description: True to automatically purge event listeners after uncaching an element (defaults to false). Note: this only happens if enableGarbageCollector is true.

property.name: SSL_SECURE_URL
property.description: URL to a blank file used by Ext when in secure mode for iframe src and onReady src to prevent the IE insecure content warning (defaults to javascript:false).

property.name: BLANK_IMAGE_URL
property.description: URL to a 1x1 transparent gif image used by Ext to create inline icons with CSS background images. (Defaults to "http://extjs.com/s.gif" and you should change this to a URL on your server).

property.name: emptyFn
property.description: A reusable empty function

property.name: isOpera
property.description: True if the detected browser is Opera.

property.name: isSafari
property.description: True if the detected browser is Safari.

property.name: isSafari3
property.description: True if the detected browser is Safari 3.x.

property.name: isSafari2
property.description: True if the detected browser is Safari 2.x.

property.name: isIE
property.description: True if the detected browser is Internet Explorer.

property.name: isIE6
property.description: True if the detected browser is Internet Explorer 6.x.

property.name: isIE7
property.description: True if the detected browser is Internet Explorer 7.x.

property.name: isGecko
property.description: True if the detected browser uses the Gecko layout engine (e.g. Mozilla, Firefox).

property.name: isGecko2
property.description: True if the detected browser uses a pre-Gecko 1.9 layout engine (e.g. Firefox 2.x).

property.name: isGecko3
property.description: True if the detected browser uses a Gecko 1.9+ layout engine (e.g. Firefox 3.x).

property.name: isBorderBox
property.description: True if the detected browser is Internet Explorer running in non-strict mode.

property.name: isLinux
property.description: True if the detected platform is Linux.

property.name: isWindows
property.description: True if the detected platform is Windows.

property.name: isMac
property.description: True if the detected platform is Mac OS.

property.name: isAir
property.description: True if the detected platform is Adobe Air.

property.name: useShims
property.description: By default, Ext intelligently decides whether floating elements should be shimmed. If you are using flash, you may want to set this to true.

method.name: applyIf
method.description: Copies all the properties of config to obj if they don't already exist.

parameter.name: obj
parameter.description: The receiver of the properties

parameter.name: config
parameter.description: The source of the properties

method.name: addBehaviors

parameter.name: obj
parameter.description: The list of behaviors to apply

method.name: id
method.description: Generates unique ids. If the element already has an id, it is unchanged

parameter.name: el
parameter.description: (optional) The element to generate an id for

parameter.name: prefix
parameter.description: (optional) Id prefix (defaults "ext-gen")

method.name: extend

parameter.name: subclass
parameter.description: The class inheriting the functionality

parameter.name: superclass
parameter.description: The class being extended

parameter.name: overrides
parameter.description: (optional) A literal with members which are copied into the subclass's prototype, and are therefore shared between all instances of the new class.

method.name: override

parameter.name: origclass
parameter.description: The class to override

parameter.name: overrides
parameter.description: The list of functions to add to origClass. This should be specified as an object literal containing one or more methods.

method.name: namespace
urlEncode
method.description: Takes an object and converts it to an encoded URL. e.g. Ext.urlEncode({foo: 1, bar: 2}); would return "foo=1&bar=2". Optionally, property values can be arrays, instead of keys and the resulting string that's returned will contain a name/value pair for each array value.

method.name: urlDecode
method.description: Takes an encoded URL and and converts it to an object. e.g. Ext.urlDecode("foo=1&bar=2"); would return {foo: 1, bar: 2} or Ext.urlDecode("foo=1&bar=2&bar=3&bar=4", true); would return {foo: 1, bar: [2, 3, 4]}.

parameter.name: overwrite
parameter.description: (optional) Items of the same name will overwrite previous values instead of creating an an array (Defaults to false).

method.name: each
method.description: Iterates an array calling the passed function with each item, stopping if your function returns false. If the passed array is not really an array, your function is called once with it. The supplied function is called with (Object item, Number index, Array allItems).

method.name: escapeRe
method.description: Escapes the passed string for use in a regular expression

method.name: getDom
method.description: Return the dom node for the passed string (id), dom node, or Ext.Element

method.name: getDoc
method.description: Returns the current HTML document object as an Ext.Element.

method.name: getBody
method.description: Returns the current document body as an Ext.Element.

method.name: getCmp
method.description: Shorthand for Ext.ComponentMgr.get

method.name: num
method.description: Utility method for validating that a value is numeric, returning the specified default value if it is not.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: Should be a number, but any type will be handled appropriately

parameter.name: defaultValue
parameter.description: The value to return if the original value is non-numeric

method.name: destroy
method.description: Attempts to destroy any objects passed to it by removing all event listeners, removing them from the DOM (if applicable) and calling their destroy functions (if available). This method is primarily intended for arguments of type Ext.Element and Ext.Component, but any subclass of Ext.util.Observable can be passed in. Any number of elements and/or components can be passed into this function in a single call as separate arguments.

parameter.name: arg1
parameter.description: An Ext.Element or Ext.Component to destroy

parameter.name: arg2
parameter.description: (optional)

parameter.name: etc...
parameter.description: (optional)

method.name: removeNode
method.description: Removes a DOM node from the document. The body node will be ignored if passed in.

parameter.name: node
parameter.description: The node to remove

method.name: type
method.description:
Returns the type of object that is passed in. If the object passed in is null or undefined it return false otherwise it returns one of the following values:
  • string: If the object passed is a string
  • number: If the object passed is a number
  • boolean: If the object passed is a boolean value
  • function: If the object passed is a function reference
  • object: If the object passed is an object
  • array: If the object passed is an array
  • regexp: If the object passed is a regular expression
  • element: If the object passed is a DOM Element
  • nodelist: If the object passed is a DOM NodeList
  • textnode: If the object passed is a DOM text node and contains something other than whitespace
  • whitespace: If the object passed is a DOM text node and contains only whitespace

method.name: isEmpty
method.description: Returns true if the passed value is null, undefined or an empty string (optional).

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The value to test

parameter.name: allowBlank
parameter.description: (optional) Pass true if an empty string is not considered empty

method.name: isArray
method.description: Returns true if the passed object is a JavaScript array, otherwise false.

parameter.name: The
parameter.description: object to test

method.name: isDate
method.description: Returns true if the passed object is a JavaScript date object, otherwise false.

parameter.name: The
parameter.description: object to test

method.name: select
method.description: Selects elements based on the passed CSS selector to enable working on them as 1.

parameter.name: selector
parameter.description: The CSS selector or an array of elements

parameter.name: unique
parameter.description: (optional) true to create a unique Ext.Element for each element (defaults to a shared flyweight object)

parameter.name: root
parameter.description: (optional) The root element of the query or id of the root

method.name: query
method.description: Selects an array of DOM nodes by CSS/XPath selector. Shorthand of Ext.DomQuery.select

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: The selector/xpath query

parameter.name: root
parameter.description: (optional) The start of the query (defaults to document).

method.name: get
method.description: Static method to retrieve Element objects. Uses simple caching to consistently return the same object. Automatically fixes if an object was recreated with the same id via AJAX or DOM. Shorthand of Ext.Element.get

parameter.name: el
parameter.description: The id of the node, a DOM Node or an existing Element.

method.name: fly
method.description: <static> Gets the globally shared flyweight Element, with the passed node as the active element. Do not store a reference to this element - the dom node can be overwritten by other code. Shorthand of Ext.Element.fly

parameter.name: el
parameter.description: The dom node or id

parameter.name: named
parameter.description: (optional) Allows for creation of named reusable flyweights to prevent conflicts (e.g. internally Ext uses "_internal")

method.name: onReady
method.description: Fires when the document is ready (before onload and before images are loaded). Shorthand of Ext.EventManager.onDocumentReady.

parameter.name: fn
parameter.description: The method the event invokes

parameter.name: scope
parameter.description: An object that becomes the scope of the handler

parameter.name: override
parameter.description: If true, the obj passed in becomes the execution scope of the listener

method.name: apply
method.description: Copies all the properties of config to obj.

parameter.name: obj
parameter.description: The receiver of the properties

parameter.name: config
parameter.description: The source of the properties

parameter.name: defaults
parameter.description: A different object that will also be applied for default values

method.name: encode
method.description: Shorthand for Ext.util.JSON.encode

parameter.name: o
parameter.description: The variable to encode

method.name: decode
method.description: Shorthand for Ext.util.JSON.decode

parameter.name: json
parameter.description: The JSON string

method.name: reg
method.description: Shorthand for Ext.ComponentMgr.registerType

parameter.name: xtype
parameter.description: The mnemonic string by which the Component class may be looked up.

parameter.name: cls
parameter.description: The new Component class.

class.description:
An Action is a piece of reusable functionality that can be abstracted out of any particular component so that it can be usefully shared among multiple components. Actions let you share handlers, configuration options and UI updates across any components that support the Action interface (primarily Ext.Toolbar, Ext.Button and Ext.menu.Menu components).

Aside from supporting the config object interface, any component that needs to use Actions must also support the following method list, as these will be called as needed by the Action class: setText(string), setIconCls(string), setDisabled(boolean), setVisible(boolean) and setHandler(function).

Example usage:
// Define the shared action.  Each component below will have the same
// display text and icon, and will display the same message on click.
var action = new Ext.Action({
    text: 'Do something',
    handler: function(){
        Ext.Msg.alert('Click', 'You did something.');
    },
    iconCls: 'do-something'
});

var panel = new Ext.Panel({
    title: 'Actions',
    width:500,
    height:300,
    tbar: [
        // Add the action directly to a toolbar as a menu button
        action, {
            text: 'Action Menu',
            // Add the action to a menu as a text item
            menu: [action]
        }
    ],
    items: [
        // Add the action to the panel body as a standard button
        new Ext.Button(action)
    ],
    renderTo: Ext.getBody()
});

// Change the text for all components using the action
action.setText('Something else');

parameter.name: config
parameter.description: The configuration options

property.name: isDisabled
property.description: Returns true if the components using this action are currently disabled, else returns false. Read-only.

property.name: isHidden
property.description: Returns true if the components using this action are currently hidden, else returns false. Read-only.

method.name: setText
method.description: Sets the text to be displayed by all components using this action.

parameter.name: text
parameter.description: The text to display

method.name: getText
method.description: Gets the text currently displayed by all components using this action.

method.name: setIconClass
method.description: Sets the icon CSS class for all components using this action. The class should supply a background image that will be used as the icon image.

parameter.name: cls
parameter.description: The CSS class supplying the icon image

method.name: getIconClass
method.description: Gets the icon CSS class currently used by all components using this action.

method.name: setDisabled
method.description: Sets the disabled state of all components using this action. Shortcut method for enable and disable.

parameter.name: disabled
parameter.description: True to disable the component, false to enable it

method.name: enable
method.description: Enables all components using this action.

method.name: disable
method.description: Disables all components using this action.

method.name: setHidden
method.description: Sets the hidden state of all components using this action. Shortcut method for hide and show.

parameter.name: hidden
parameter.description: True to hide the component, false to show it

method.name: show
method.description: Shows all components using this action.

method.name: hide
method.description: Hides all components using this action.

method.name: setHandler
method.description: Sets the function that will be called by each component using this action when its primary event is triggered.

parameter.name: fn
parameter.description: The function that will be invoked by the action's components. The function will be called with no arguments.

parameter.name: scope
parameter.description: The scope in which the function will execute

method.name: each
method.description: Executes the specified function once for each component currently tied to this action. The function passed in should accept a single argument that will be an object that supports the basic Action config/method interface.

parameter.name: fn
parameter.description: The function to execute for each component

parameter.name: scope
parameter.description: The scope in which the function will execute

method.name: execute
method.description: Executes this action manually using the default handler specified in the original config object. Any arguments passed to this function will be passed on to the handler function.

parameter.name: arg1
parameter.description: (optional) Variable number of arguments passed to the handler function

parameter.name: arg2
parameter.description: (optional)

parameter.name: etc...
parameter.description: (optional)

property.name: disableCaching
property.description: True to add a unique cache-buster param to GET requests. (defaults to true)

property.name: url
property.description: The default URL to be used for requests to the server. (defaults to undefined)

property.name: extraParams
property.description: An object containing properties which are used as extra parameters to each request made by this object. (defaults to undefined)

property.name: defaultHeaders
property.description: An object containing request headers which are added to each request made by this object. (defaults to undefined)

property.name: method
property.description: The default HTTP method to be used for requests. Note that this is case-sensitive and should be all caps (defaults to undefined; if not set but parms are present will use "POST," otherwise "GET.")

property.name: timeout
property.description: The timeout in milliseconds to be used for requests. (defaults to 30000)

property.name: autoAbort
property.description: Whether a new request should abort any pending requests. (defaults to false)

method.name: serializeForm
method.description: Serialize the passed form into a url encoded string

class.description: Base class for any visual Ext.Component that uses a box container. BoxComponent provides automatic box model adjustments for sizing and positioning and will work correctly withnin the Component rendering model. All container classes should subclass BoxComponent so that they will work consistently when nested within other Ext layout containers.

parameter.name: config
parameter.description: The configuration options.

method.name: setSize
method.description: Sets the width and height of the component. This method fires the resize event. This method can accept either width and height as separate numeric arguments, or you can pass a size object like {width:10, height:20}.

parameter.name: width
parameter.description: The new width to set, or a size object in the format {width, height}

parameter.name: height
parameter.description: The new height to set (not required if a size object is passed as the first arg)

method.name: setWidth
method.description: Sets the width of the component. This method fires the resize event.

parameter.name: width
parameter.description: The new width to set

method.name: setHeight
method.description: Sets the height of the component. This method fires the resize event.

parameter.name: height
parameter.description: The new height to set

method.name: getSize
method.description: Gets the current size of the component's underlying element.

method.name: getPosition
method.description: Gets the current XY position of the component's underlying element.

parameter.name: local
parameter.description: (optional) If true the element's left and top are returned instead of page XY (defaults to false)

method.name: getBox
method.description: Gets the current box measurements of the component's underlying element.

parameter.name: local
parameter.description: (optional) If true the element's left and top are returned instead of page XY (defaults to false)

method.name: updateBox
method.description: Sets the current box measurements of the component's underlying element.

parameter.name: box
parameter.description: An object in the format {x, y, width, height}

method.name: setPosition
method.description: Sets the left and top of the component. To set the page XY position instead, use setPagePosition. This method fires the move event.

parameter.name: left
parameter.description: The new left

parameter.name: top
parameter.description: The new top

method.name: setPagePosition
method.description: Sets the page XY position of the component. To set the left and top instead, use setPosition. This method fires the move event.

parameter.name: x
parameter.description: The new x position

parameter.name: y
parameter.description: The new y position

method.name: syncSize
method.description: Force the component's size to recalculate based on the underlying element's current height and width.

class.description: Simple Button class

property.name: pressed
property.description: Read-only. True if this button is pressed (only if enableToggle = true)

property.name: ownerCt
property.description: The Button's owner Ext.Panel (defaults to undefined, and is set automatically when the Button is added to a container). Read-only.

method.name: setIconClass
method.description: Sets the CSS class that provides a background image to use as the button's icon. This method also changes the value of the iconCls config internally.

parameter.name: cls

method.name: setHandler
method.description: Assigns this button's click handler

parameter.name: handler
parameter.description: The function to call when the button is clicked

parameter.name: scope

method.description: Gets the text for this button

method.description: If a state it passed, it becomes the pressed state otherwise the current state is toggled.

parameter.description: (optional) Force a particular state

method.description: Focus the button

method.name: showMenu
method.description: Show this button's menu (if it has one)

method.name: hideMenu
method.description: Hide this button's menu (if it has one)

parameter.name: config
parameter.description: The config object

property.name: colors
property.description:
An array of 6-digit color hex code strings (without the # symbol). This array can contain any number of colors, and each hex code should be unique. The width of the palette is controlled via CSS by adjusting the width property of the 'x-color-palette' class (or assigning a custom class), so you can balance the number of colors with the width setting until the box is symmetrical.

You can override individual colors if needed:

var cp = new Ext.ColorPalette();
cp.colors[0] = "FF0000";  // change the first box to red
Or you can provide a custom array of your own for complete control: 
var cp = new Ext.ColorPalette();
cp.colors = ["000000", "993300", "333300"];

method.name: select
method.description: Selects the specified color in the palette (fires the select event)

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: A valid 6-digit color hex code (# will be stripped if included)

class.description:
Base class for all Ext components. All subclasses of Component can automatically participate in the standard Ext component lifecycle of creation, rendering and destruction. They also have automatic support for basic hide/show and enable/disable behavior. Component allows any subclass to be lazy-rendered into any Ext.Container and to be automatically registered with the Ext.ComponentMgr so that it can be referenced at any time via Ext.getCmp. All visual widgets that require rendering into a layout should subclass Component (or Ext.BoxComponent if managed box model handling is required).

Every component has a specific xtype, which is its Ext-specific type name, along with methods for checking the xtype like getXType and isXType. This is the list of all valid xtypes:

xtype            Class
-------------    ------------------
box              Ext.BoxComponent
button           Ext.Button
colorpalette     Ext.ColorPalette
component        Ext.Component
container        Ext.Container
cycle            Ext.CycleButton
dataview         Ext.DataView
datepicker       Ext.DatePicker
editor           Ext.Editor
editorgrid       Ext.grid.EditorGridPanel
grid             Ext.grid.GridPanel
paging           Ext.PagingToolbar
panel            Ext.Panel
progress         Ext.ProgressBar
propertygrid     Ext.grid.PropertyGrid
slider           Ext.Slider
splitbutton      Ext.SplitButton
statusbar        Ext.StatusBar
tabpanel         Ext.TabPanel
treepanel        Ext.tree.TreePanel
viewport         Ext.Viewport
window           Ext.Window

Toolbar components
---------------------------------------
toolbar          Ext.Toolbar
tbbutton         Ext.Toolbar.Button
tbfill           Ext.Toolbar.Fill
tbitem           Ext.Toolbar.Item
tbseparator      Ext.Toolbar.Separator
tbspacer         Ext.Toolbar.Spacer
tbsplit          Ext.Toolbar.SplitButton
tbtext           Ext.Toolbar.TextItem

Form components
---------------------------------------
form             Ext.FormPanel
checkbox         Ext.form.Checkbox
combo            Ext.form.ComboBox
datefield        Ext.form.DateField
field            Ext.form.Field
fieldset         Ext.form.FieldSet
hidden           Ext.form.Hidden
htmleditor       Ext.form.HtmlEditor
label            Ext.form.Label
numberfield      Ext.form.NumberField
radio            Ext.form.Radio
textarea         Ext.form.TextArea
textfield        Ext.form.TextField
timefield        Ext.form.TimeField
trigger          Ext.form.TriggerField

parameter.name: config
parameter.description: The configuration options. If an element is passed, it is set as the internal element and its id used as the component id. If a string is passed, it is assumed to be the id of an existing element and is used as the component id. Otherwise, it is assumed to be a standard config object and is applied to the component.

property.name: initialConfig
property.description: This Component's initial configuration specification. Read-only.

property.name: ownerCt
property.description: The component's owner Ext.Container (defaults to undefined, and is set automatically when the component is added to a container). Read-only.

property.name: hidden
property.description: True if this component is hidden. Read-only.

property.name: disabled
property.description: True if this component is disabled. Read-only.

property.name: rendered
property.description: True if this component has been rendered. Read-only.

method.name: render
method.description:
Render this Components into the passed HTML element.

If you are using a Container object to house this Component, then do not use the render method.

A Container's child Components are rendered by that Container's layout manager when the Container is first rendered.

Certain layout managers allow dynamic addition of child components. Those that do include Ext.layout.CardLayout, Ext.layout.AnchorLayout, Ext.layout.FormLayout, Ext.layout.TableLayout.

If the Container is already rendered when a new child Component is added, you may need to call the Container's doLayout to refresh the view which causes any unrendered child Components to be rendered. This is required so that you can add multiple child components if needed while only refreshing the layout once.

When creating complex UIs, it is important to remember that sizing and positioning of child items is the responsibility of the Container's layout manager. If you expect child items to be sized in response to user interactions, you must configure the Container with a layout manager which creates and manages the type of layout you have in mind.

Omitting the Container's layout config means that a basic layout manager is used which does nothnig but render child components sequentially into the Container. No sizing or positioning will be performed in this situation.

parameter.name: container
parameter.description: (optional) The element this Component should be rendered into. If it is being created from existing markup, this should be omitted.

parameter.name: position
parameter.description: (optional) The element ID or DOM node index within the container before which this component will be inserted (defaults to appending to the end of the container)

method.name: applyToMarkup
method.description: Apply this component to existing markup that is valid. With this function, no call to render() is required.

method.name: addClass
method.description: Adds a CSS class to the component's underlying element.

parameter.name: cls
parameter.description: The CSS class name to add

method.name: removeClass
method.description: Removes a CSS class from the component's underlying element.

parameter.name: cls
parameter.description: The CSS class name to remove

method.name: destroy
method.description: Destroys this component by purging any event listeners, removing the component's element from the DOM, removing the component from its Ext.Container (if applicable) and unregistering it from Ext.ComponentMgr. Destruction is generally handled automatically by the framework and this method should usually not need to be called directly.

method.name: getEl
method.description: Returns the underlying Ext.Element.

method.name: getId
method.description: Returns the id of this component.

method.name: getItemId
method.description: Returns the item id of this component.

method.name: focus
method.description: Try to focus this component.

parameter.name: selectText
parameter.description: (optional) If applicable, true to also select the text in this component

parameter.name: delay
parameter.description: (optional) Delay the focus this number of milliseconds (true for 10 milliseconds)

method.name: disable
method.description: Disable this component.

method.name: enable
method.description: Enable this component.

method.name: setDisabled
method.description: Convenience function for setting disabled/enabled by boolean.

method.name: show
method.description: Show this component.

method.name: hide
method.description: Hide this component.

method.name: setVisible
method.description: Convenience function to hide or show this component by boolean.

parameter.name: visible
parameter.description: True to show, false to hide

method.name: isVisible
method.description: Returns true if this component is visible.

method.name: cloneConfig
method.description: Clone the current component using the original config values passed into this instance by default.

parameter.name: overrides
parameter.description: A new config containing any properties to override in the cloned version. An id property can be passed on this object, otherwise one will be generated to avoid duplicates.

method.name: getXType
method.description:
Gets the xtype for this component as registered with Ext.ComponentMgr. For a list of all available xtypes, see the Ext.Component header. Example usage: 
var t = new Ext.form.TextField();
alert(t.getXType());  // alerts 'textfield'

method.name: isXType
method.description:
Tests whether or not this Component is of a specific xtype. This can test whether this Component is descended from the xtype (default) or whether it is directly of the xtype specified (shallow = true).

If using your own subclasses, be aware that a Component must register its own xtype to participate in determination of inherited xtypes.

For a list of all available xtypes, see the Ext.Component header.

Example usage:

var t = new Ext.form.TextField();
var isText = t.isXType('textfield');        // true
var isBoxSubclass = t.isXType('box');       // true, descended from BoxComponent
var isBoxInstance = t.isXType('box', true); // false, not a direct BoxComponent instance

parameter.name: xtype
parameter.description: The xtype to check for this Component

parameter.name: shallow
parameter.description: (optional) False to check whether this Component is descended from the xtype (this is the default), or true to check whether this Component is directly of the specified xtype.

method.name: getXTypes
method.description:
Returns this Component's xtype hierarchy as a slash-delimited string. For a list of all available xtypes, see the Ext.Component header.

If using your own subclasses, be aware that a Component must register its own xtype to participate in determination of inherited xtypes.

Example usage:


var t = new Ext.form.TextField();
alert(t.getXTypes());  // alerts 'component/box/field/textfield'

method.name: findParentBy
method.description: Find a container above this component at any level by a custom function. If the passed function returns true, the container will be returned. The passed function is called with the arguments (container, this component).

parameter.name: scope
parameter.description: (optional)

method.name: findParentByType
method.description: Find a container above this component at any level by xtype or class

parameter.name: xtype
parameter.description: The xtype string for a component, or the class of the component directly

class.description:
Provides a registry of all Components (specifically subclasses of Ext.Component) on a page so that they can be easily accessed by component id (see Ext.getCmp).

This object also provides a registry of available Component classes indexed by a mnemonic code known as the Component's Ext.Component.xtype. The xtype provides a way to avoid instantiating child Components when creating a full, nested config object for a complete Ext page.

A child Component may be specified simply as a config object as long as the correct xtype is specified so that if and when the Component needs rendering, the correct type can be looked up for lazy instantiation.

For a list of all available xtypes, see Ext.Component.



This class is a singleton and cannot be created directly.

property.name: all
property.description: The MixedCollection used internally for the component cache. An example usage may be subscribing to events on the MixedCollection to monitor addition or removal. Read-only.

method.name: register
method.description: Registers a component.

parameter.name: c
parameter.description: The component

method.name: unregister

parameter.name: c

method.name: get

Registers a new Component constructor, keyed by a new Ext.Component.xtype.

Use this method to register new subclasses of Ext.Component so that lazy instantiation may be used when specifying child Components. see Ext.Container.items

parameter.description: The constructor to provide the default Component type if the config object does not contain an xtype. (Optional if the config contains an xtype).

method.name: fill

method.name: filter
method.description: Filters this composite to only elements that match the passed selector.

parameter.name: selector

method.name: add
method.description: Adds elements to this composite.

parameter.name: els
parameter.description: A string CSS selector, an array of elements or an element

method.name: each
method.description: Calls the passed function passing (el, this, index) for each element in this composite.

parameter.name: fn
parameter.description: The function to call

parameter.name: scope

method.name: item
method.description: Returns the Element object at the specified index

method.name: first
method.description: Returns the first Element

method.name: last
method.description: Returns the last Element

method.name: getCount

parameter.name: {Mixed}

method.name: indexOf
method.description: Find the index of the passed element within the composite collection.

parameter.name: {Mixed}
parameter.description: The id of an element, or an Ext.Element, or an HtmlElement to find within the composite collection.

method.name: removeElement
method.description: Removes the specified element(s).

parameter.name: el
parameter.description: The id of an element, the Element itself, the index of the element in this composite or an array of any of those.

parameter.name: removeDom

method.name: replaceElement
method.description: Replaces the specified element with the passed element.

parameter.name: el
parameter.description: The id of an element, the Element itself, the index of the element in this composite to replace.

parameter.name: replacement

parameter.name: domReplace
parameter.description: (Optional) True to remove and replace the element in the document too.

method.name: clear
method.description: Removes all elements.

method.name: item
method.description: Returns a flyweight Element of the dom element object at the specified index

method.name: each
method.description: Calls the passed function passing (el, this, index) for each element in this composite. The element passed is the flyweight (shared) Ext.Element instance, so if you require a a reference to the dom node, use el.dom.

parameter.name: fn
parameter.description: The function to call

parameter.name: scope
parameter.description: (optional) The this object (defaults to the element)

class.description:
Base class for any Ext.BoxComponent that can contain other components. This class is intended to be extended and should generally not need to be created directly via the new keyword. Ext.Panel, Ext.Window and Ext.TabPanel are the most commonly used Container classes.

Containers handle the basic behavior of containing items, namely adding, inserting and removing them. The specific layout logic required to visually render contained items is delegated to any one of the different layout classes available.

When either specifying child items of a Container, or dynamically adding components to a Container, remember to consider how you wish the Container to arrange those child elements, and whether those child elements need to be sized using one of Ext's built-in layout schemes.

By default, Containers use the ContainerLayout scheme. This simply renders child components, appending them one after the other inside the Container, and does not apply any sizing at all. This is a common source of confusion when widgets like GridPanels or TreePanels are added to Containers for which no layout has been specified. If a Container is left to use the ContainerLayout scheme, none of its child components will be resized, or changed in any way when the Container is resized.

A very common example of this is where a developer will attempt to add a GridPanel to a TabPanel by wrapping the GridPanel inside a wrapping Panel and add that wrapping Panel to the TabPanel. This misses the point that Ext's inheritance means that a GridPanel is a Component which can be added unadorned into a Container. If that wrapping Panel has no layout configuration, then the GridPanel will not be sized as expected.

Below is an example of adding a newly created GridPanel to a TabPanel. A TabPanel uses Ext.layout.CardLayout as its layout manager which means all its child items are sized to fit exactly into its client area. The following code requires prior knowledge of how to create GridPanels. See Ext.grid.GridPanel, Ext.data.Store and Ext.data.JsonReader as well as the grid examples in the Ext installation's examples/grid directory.

//  Create the GridPanel.
myGrid = new Ext.grid.GridPanel({
    store: myStore,
    columns: myColumnModel,
    title: 'Results',
});

myTabPanel.add(myGrid);
myTabPanel.setActiveItem(myGrid);

property.name: items
property.description: The collection of components in this container as a Ext.util.MixedCollection

method.name: add
method.description:
Adds a Component to this Container. Fires the beforeadd event before adding, then fires the add event after the component has been added.

You will never call the render method of a child Component when using a Container. Child Components are rendered by this Container's layout manager when this Container is first rendered.

Certain layout managers allow dynamic addition of child components. Those that do include Ext.layout.CardLayout, Ext.layout.AnchorLayout, Ext.layout.FormLayout, Ext.layout.TableLayout.

If the Container is already rendered when add is called, you may need to call doLayout to refresh the view which causes any unrendered child Components to be rendered. This is required so that you can add multiple child components if needed while only refreshing the layout once.

When creating complex UIs, it is important to remember that sizing and positioning of child items is the responsibility of the Container's layout manager. If you expect child items to be sized in response to user interactions, you must specify a layout manager which creates and manages the type of layout you have in mind.

Omitting the layout config means that a basic layout manager is used which does nothnig but render child components sequentially into the Container. No sizing or positioning will be performed in this situation.

parameter.name: component
parameter.description:
The Component to add.

Ext uses lazy rendering, and will only render the added Component should it become necessary, that is: when the Container is layed out either on first render or in response to a doLayout call.

A Component config object may be passed instead of an instantiated Component object. The type of Component created from a config object is determined by the xtype config property. If no xtype is configured, the Container's defaultType is used.

For a list of all available xtypes, see Ext.Component.

method.name: insert
method.description: Inserts a Component into this Container at a specified index. Fires the beforeadd event before inserting, then fires the add event after the Component has been inserted.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: The index at which the Component will be inserted into the Container's items collection

parameter.name: component
parameter.description:
The child Component to insert.

Ext uses lazy rendering, and will only render the inserted Component should it become necessary.

A Component config object may be passed in order to avoid the overhead of constructing a real Component object if lazy rendering might mean that the inserted Component will not be rendered immediately. To take advantage of this "lazy instantiation", set the Ext.Component.xtype config property to the registered type of the Component wanted.

For a list of all available xtypes, see Ext.Component.

method.name: remove
method.description: Removes a component from this container. Fires the beforeremove event before removing, then fires the remove event after the component has been removed.

parameter.name: component
parameter.description: The component reference or id to remove.

parameter.name: autoDestroy
parameter.description: (optional) True to automatically invoke the removed Component's Ext.Component.destroy function. Defaults to the value of this Container's autoDestroy config.

method.name: getComponent
method.description: Gets a direct child Component by id, or by index.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: or index of child Component to return.

method.name: doLayout
method.description: Force this container's layout to be recalculated. A call to this function is required after adding a new component to an already rendered container, or possibly after changing sizing/position properties of child components.

parameter.name: shallow
parameter.description: (optional) True to only calc the layout of this component, and let child components auto calc layouts as required (defaults to false, which calls doLayout recursively for each subcontainer)

method.name: getLayout
method.description: Returns the layout currently in use by the container. If the container does not currently have a layout set, a default Ext.layout.ContainerLayout will be created and set as the container's layout.

method.name: bubble
method.description: Bubbles up the component/container heirarchy, calling the specified function with each component. The scope (this) of function call will be the scope provided or the current component. The arguments to the function will be the args provided or the current component. If the function returns false at any point, the bubble is stopped.

parameter.name: fn
parameter.description: The function to call

parameter.name: scope
parameter.description: (optional) The scope of the function (defaults to current node)

parameter.name: args
parameter.description: (optional) The args to call the function with (default to passing the current component)

method.name: cascade
method.description: Cascades down the component/container heirarchy from this component (called first), calling the specified function with each component. The scope (this) of function call will be the scope provided or the current component. The arguments to the function will be the args provided or the current component. If the function returns false at any point, the cascade is stopped on that branch.

parameter.name: fn
parameter.description: The function to call

parameter.name: scope
parameter.description: (optional) The scope of the function (defaults to current component)

parameter.name: args
parameter.description: (optional) The args to call the function with (defaults to passing the current component)

method.name: findById
method.description: Find a component under this container at any level by id

method.name: findByType
method.description: Find a component under this container at any level by xtype or class

parameter.name: xtype
parameter.description: The xtype string for a component, or the class of the component directly

method.name: find
method.description: Find a component under this container at any level by property

method.name: findBy
method.description: Find a component under this container at any level by a custom function. If the passed function returns true, the component will be included in the results. The passed function is called with the arguments (component, this container).

parameter.name: scope
parameter.description: (optional)

parameter.name: config
parameter.description: The config object

method.name: setActiveItem
method.description: Sets the button's active menu item.

parameter.name: item
parameter.description: The item to activate

parameter.name: suppressEvent
parameter.description: True to prevent the button's change event from firing (defaults to false)

method.name: getActiveItem
method.description: Gets the currently active menu item.

method.name: toggleSelected
method.description: This is normally called internally on button click, but can be called externally to advance the button's active item programmatically to the next one in the menu. If the current item is the last one in the menu the active item will be set to the first item in the menu.

parameter.name: config
parameter.description: The config object

method.name: refresh
method.description: Refreshes the view by reloading the data from the store and re-rendering the template.

method.name: prepareData
method.description: Function which can be overridden to provide custom formatting for each Record that is used by this DataView's template to render each node.

parameter.name: data
parameter.description: The raw data object that was used to create the Record.

parameter.name: recordIndex
parameter.description: the index number of the Record being prepared for rendering.

parameter.name: record
parameter.description: The Record being prepared for rendering.

method.name: collectData
method.description:
Function which can be overridden which returns the data object passed to this DataView's template to render the whole DataView.

This is usually an Array of data objects, each element of which is processed by an XTemplate which uses '<tpl for=".">' to iterate over its supplied data object as an Array. However, named properties may be placed into the data object to provide non-repeating data such as headings, totals etc.

parameter.name: {Array}
parameter.description: An Array of Ext.data.Records to be rendered into the DataView.

method.name: refreshNode
method.description: Refreshes an individual node's data from the store.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: The item's data index in the store

method.name: setStore
method.description: Changes the data store bound to this view and refreshes it.

parameter.name: store
parameter.description: The store to bind to this view

method.name: findItemFromChild
method.description: Returns the template node the passed child belongs to, or null if it doesn't belong to one.

method.name: getSelectionCount

method.name: getSelectedNodes
method.description: Gets the currently selected nodes.

method.name: getSelectedIndexes
method.description: Gets the indexes of the selected nodes.

method.name: getRecord

parameter.name: node

method.name: selectRange

method.name: getNode
method.description: Gets a template node.

parameter.name: nodeInfo
parameter.description: An HTMLElement template node, index of a template node or the id of a template node

method.name: getNodes
method.description: Gets a range nodes.

parameter.name: start

method.name: indexOf
method.description: Finds the index of the passed node.

parameter.name: nodeInfo
parameter.description: An HTMLElement template node, index of a template node or the id of a template node

class.description: Simple date picker class.

method.description: Replaces any existing disabled dates with new values and refreshes the DatePicker.

class.description:
Utility class for working with DOM and/or Templates. It transparently supports using HTML fragments or DOM.
This is an example, where an unordered list with 5 children items is appended to an existing element with id 'my-div':
var dh = Ext.DomHelper;
var list = dh.append('my-div', {
    id: 'my-ul', tag: 'ul', cls: 'my-list', children: [
        {tag: 'li', id: 'item0', html: 'List Item 0'},
        {tag: 'li', id: 'item1', html: 'List Item 1'},
        {tag: 'li', id: 'item2', html: 'List Item 2'},
        {tag: 'li', id: 'item3', html: 'List Item 3'},
        {tag: 'li', id: 'item4', html: 'List Item 4'}
    ]
});

Element creation specification parameters in this class may also be passed as an Array of specification objects. This can be used to insert multiple sibling nodes into an existing container very efficiently. For example, to add more list items to the example above:

dh.append('my-ul', [
    {tag: 'li', id: 'item5', html: 'List Item 5'},
    {tag: 'li', id: 'item6', html: 'List Item 6'} ]);

Element creation specification parameters may also be strings. If useDom is false, then the string is used as innerHTML. If useDom is true, a string specification results in the creation of a text node.

For more information and examples, see the original blog post.

This class is a singleton and cannot be created directly.

property.name: useDom
property.description: True to force the use of DOM instead of html fragments

class.description:
* Provides high performance selector/xpath processing by compiling queries into reusable functions. New pseudo classes and matchers can be plugged. It works on HTML and XML documents (if a content node is passed in).

DomQuery supports most of the CSS3 selectors spec, along with some custom selectors and basic XPath.

All selectors, attribute filters and pseudos below can be combined infinitely in any order. For example "div.foo:nth-child(odd)[@foo=bar].bar:first" would be a perfectly valid selector. Node filters are processed in the order in which they appear, which allows you to optimize your queries for your document structure.

Element Selectors:

  • * any element
  • E an element with the tag E
  • E F All descendent elements of E that have the tag F
  • E > F or E/F all direct children elements of E that have the tag F
  • E + F all elements with the tag F that are immediately preceded by an element with the tag E
  • E ~ F all elements with the tag F that are preceded by a sibling element with the tag E

Attribute Selectors:

The use of @ and quotes are optional. For example, div[@foo='bar'] is also a valid attribute selector.

  • E[foo] has an attribute "foo"
  • E[foo=bar] has an attribute "foo" that equals "bar"
  • E[foo^=bar] has an attribute "foo" that starts with "bar"
  • E[foo$=bar] has an attribute "foo" that ends with "bar"
  • E[foo*=bar] has an attribute "foo" that contains the substring "bar"
  • E[foo%=2] has an attribute "foo" that is evenly divisible by 2
  • E[foo!=bar] has an attribute "foo" that does not equal "bar"

Pseudo Classes:

  • E:first-child E is the first child of its parent
  • E:last-child E is the last child of its parent
  • E:nth-child(n) E is the nth child of its parent (1 based as per the spec)
  • E:nth-child(odd) E is an odd child of its parent
  • E:nth-child(even) E is an even child of its parent
  • E:only-child E is the only child of its parent
  • E:checked E is an element that is has a checked attribute that is true (e.g. a radio or checkbox)
  • E:first the first E in the resultset
  • E:last the last E in the resultset
  • E:nth(n) the nth E in the resultset (1 based)
  • E:odd shortcut for :nth-child(odd)
  • E:even shortcut for :nth-child(even)
  • E:contains(foo) E's innerHTML contains the substring "foo"
  • E:nodeValue(foo) E contains a textNode with a nodeValue that equals "foo"
  • E:not(S) an E element that does not match simple selector S
  • E:has(S) an E element that has a descendent that matches simple selector S
  • E:next(S) an E element whose next sibling matches simple selector S
  • E:prev(S) an E element whose previous sibling matches simple selector S

CSS Value Selectors:

  • E{display=none} css value "display" that equals "none"
  • E{display^=none} css value "display" that starts with "none"
  • E{display$=none} css value "display" that ends with "none"
  • E{display*=none} css value "display" that contains the substring "none"
  • E{display%=2} css value "display" that is evenly divisible by 2
  • E{display!=none} css value "display" that does not equal "none"


This class is a singleton and cannot be created directly.

property.name: matchers
property.description: Collection of matching regular expressions and code snippets.

property.name: operators
property.description: Collection of operator comparison functions. The default operators are =, !=, ^=, $=, *=, %=, |= and ~=. New operators can be added as long as the match the format c= where c is any character other than space, > <.

property.name: pseudos
property.description: Collection of "pseudo class" processors. Each processor is passed the current nodeset (array) and the argument (if any) supplied in the selector.

method.name: compile
method.description: Compiles a selector/xpath query into a reusable function. The returned function takes one parameter "root" (optional), which is the context node from where the query should start.

parameter.name: selector
parameter.description: The selector/xpath query

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: (optional) Either "select" (the default) or "simple" for a simple selector match

method.name: select
method.description: Selects a group of elements.

parameter.name: selector
parameter.description: The selector/xpath query (can be a comma separated list of selectors)

parameter.name: root
parameter.description: (optional) The start of the query (defaults to document).

method.name: selectNode
method.description: Selects a single element.

parameter.name: selector
parameter.description: The selector/xpath query

parameter.name: root
parameter.description: (optional) The start of the query (defaults to document).

method.name: selectValue
method.description: Selects the value of a node, optionally replacing null with the defaultValue.

parameter.name: selector
parameter.description: The selector/xpath query

parameter.name: root
parameter.description: (optional) The start of the query (defaults to document).

method.name: selectNumber
method.description: Selects the value of a node, parsing integers and floats. Returns the defaultValue, or 0 if none is specified.

parameter.name: selector
parameter.description: The selector/xpath query

parameter.name: root
parameter.description: (optional) The start of the query (defaults to document).

method.name: is

parameter.name: el

parameter.name: selector
parameter.description: The simple selector to test

method.name: filter

parameter.name: el
parameter.description: An array of elements to filter

parameter.name: selector
parameter.description: The simple selector to test

parameter.name: nonMatches
parameter.description: If true, it returns the elements that DON'T match the selector instead of the ones that match

class.description: A base editor field that handles displaying/hiding on demand and has some built-in sizing and event handling logic.

parameter.name: width
parameter.description: The new width

parameter.name: height
parameter.description: The new height

parameter.name: animate
parameter.description: (optional) true for the default animation or a standard Element animation config object

method.name: setRegion
method.description: Sets the element's position and size the specified region. If animation is true then width, height, x and y will be animated concurrently.

parameter.name: region
parameter.description: The region to fill

parameter.name: animate
parameter.description: (optional) true for the default animation or a standard Element animation config object

method.name: addListener
method.description: Appends an event handler to this element. The shorthand version on is equivalent.

parameter.name: eventName
parameter.description: The type of event to handle

parameter.name: fn
parameter.description:
The handler function the event invokes. This function is passed the following parameters:
  • evt : EventObject
    The EventObject describing the event.
  • t : Element
    The Element which was the target of the event. Note that this may be filtered by using the delegate option.
  • o : Object
    The options object from the addListener call.

parameter.name: scope
parameter.description: (optional) The scope (The <tt>this</tt> reference) of the handler function. Defaults to this Element.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description:
(optional) An object containing handler configuration properties. This may contain any of the following properties:
  • scope {Object} : The scope in which to execute the handler function. The handler function's "this" context.
  • delegate {String} : A simple selector to filter the target or look for a descendant of the target
  • stopEvent {Boolean} : True to stop the event. That is stop propagation, and prevent the default action.
  • preventDefault {Boolean} : True to prevent the default action
  • stopPropagation {Boolean} : True to prevent event propagation
  • normalized {Boolean} : False to pass a browser event to the handler function instead of an Ext.EventObject
  • delay {Number} : The number of milliseconds to delay the invocation of the handler after te event fires.
  • single {Boolean} : True to add a handler to handle just the next firing of the event, and then remove itself.
  • buffer {Number} : Causes the handler to be scheduled to run in an Ext.util.DelayedTask delayed by the specified number of milliseconds. If the event fires again within that time, the original handler is not invoked, but the new handler is scheduled in its place.

Combining Options
In the following examples, the shorthand form on is used rather than the more verbose addListener. The two are equivalent. Using the options argument, it is possible to combine different types of listeners:

A normalized, delayed, one-time listener that auto stops the event and adds a custom argument (forumId) to the options object. The options object is available as the third parameter in the handler function.

Code:
el.on('click', this.onClick, this, {
    single: true,
    delay: 100,
    stopEvent : true,
    forumId: 4
});

Attaching multiple handlers in 1 call
The method also allows for a single argument to be passed which is a config object containing properties which specify multiple handlers.

Code:


el.on({
    'click' : {
        fn: this.onClick,
        scope: this,
        delay: 100
    },
    'mouseover' : {
        fn: this.onMouseOver,
        scope: this
    },
    'mouseout' : {
        fn: this.onMouseOut,
        scope: this
    }
});

Or a shorthand syntax:
Code:


el.on({
    'click' : this.onClick,
    'mouseover' : this.onMouseOver,
    'mouseout' : this.onMouseOut,
    scope: this
});

method.name: alignTo
method.description:
Aligns this element with another element relative to the specified anchor points. If the other element is the document it aligns it to the viewport. The position parameter is optional, and can be specified in any one of the following formats:
  • Blank: Defaults to aligning the element's top-left corner to the target's bottom-left corner ("tl-bl").
  • One anchor (deprecated): The passed anchor position is used as the target element's anchor point. The element being aligned will position its top-left corner (tl) to that point. This method has been deprecated in favor of the newer two anchor syntax below.
  • Two anchors: If two values from the table below are passed separated by a dash, the first value is used as the element's anchor point, and the second value is used as the target's anchor point.
In addition to the anchor points, the position parameter also supports the "?" character. If "?" is passed at the end of the position string, the element will attempt to align as specified, but the position will be adjusted to constrain to the viewport if necessary. Note that the element being aligned might be swapped to align to a different position than that specified in order to enforce the viewport constraints. Following are all of the supported anchor positions: 
Value  Description
-----  -----------------------------
tl     The top left corner (default)
t      The center of the top edge
tr     The top right corner
l      The center of the left edge
c      In the center of the element
r      The center of the right edge
bl     The bottom left corner
b      The center of the bottom edge
br     The bottom right corner
Example Usage: 
// align el to other-el using the default positioning ("tl-bl", non-constrained)
el.alignTo("other-el");

// align the top left corner of el with the top right corner of other-el (constrained to viewport)
el.alignTo("other-el", "tr?");

// align the bottom right corner of el with the center left edge of other-el
el.alignTo("other-el", "br-l?");

// align the center of el with the bottom left corner of other-el and
// adjust the x position by -6 pixels (and the y position by 0)
el.alignTo("other-el", "c-bl", [-6, 0]);

parameter.name: element
parameter.description: The element to align to.

parameter.name: position
parameter.description: The position to align to.

parameter.name: offsets
parameter.description: (optional) Offset the positioning by [x, y]

parameter.name: animate
parameter.description: (optional) true for the default animation or a standard Element animation config object

class.description:
Registers event handlers that want to receive a normalized EventObject instead of the standard browser event and provides several useful events directly. See Ext.EventObject for more details on normalized event objects.

This class is a singleton and cannot be created directly.

property.name: ieDeferSrc
property.description: Url used for onDocumentReady with using SSL (defaults to Ext.SSL_SECURE_URL)

property.name: textResizeInterval
property.description: The frequency, in milliseconds, to check for text resize events (defaults to 50)

method.name: addListener
method.description: Appends an event handler to an element. The shorthand version on is equivalent. Typically you will use Ext.Element.addListener directly on an Element in favor of calling this version.

parameter.name: el
parameter.description: The html element or id to assign the event handler to

parameter.name: eventName
parameter.description: The type of event to listen for

parameter.name: handler
parameter.description:
The handler function the event invokes This function is passed the following parameters:
  • evt : EventObject
    The EventObject describing the event.
  • t : Element
    The Element which was the target of the event. Note that this may be filtered by using the delegate option.
  • o : Object
    The options object from the addListener call.

parameter.name: scope
parameter.description: (optional) The scope in which to execute the handler function (the handler function's "this" context)

parameter.name: options
parameter.description:
(optional) An object containing handler configuration properties. This may contain any of the following properties:
  • scope {Object} : The scope in which to execute the handler function. The handler function's "this" context.
  • delegate {String} : A simple selector to filter the target or look for a descendant of the target
  • stopEvent {Boolean} : True to stop the event. That is stop propagation, and prevent the default action.
  • preventDefault {Boolean} : True to prevent the default action
  • stopPropagation {Boolean} : True to prevent event propagation
  • normalized {Boolean} : False to pass a browser event to the handler function instead of an Ext.EventObject
  • delay {Number} : The number of milliseconds to delay the invocation of the handler after te event fires.
  • single {Boolean} : True to add a handler to handle just the next firing of the event, and then remove itself.
  • buffer {Number} : Causes the handler to be scheduled to run in an Ext.util.DelayedTask delayed by the specified number of milliseconds. If the event fires again within that time, the original handler is not invoked, but the new handler is scheduled in its place.

See Ext.Element.addListener for examples of how to use these options.

method.name: removeListener
method.description: Removes an event handler from an element. The shorthand version un is equivalent. Typically you will use Ext.Element.removeListener directly on an Element in favor of calling this version.

parameter.name: el
parameter.description: The id or html element from which to remove the event

parameter.name: eventName
parameter.description: The type of event

parameter.name: fn
parameter.description: The handler function to remove

method.name: removeAll
method.description: Removes all event handers from an element. Typically you will use Ext.Element.removeAllListeners directly on an Element in favor of calling this version.

parameter.name: el

method.name: onDocumentReady
