class.description:
Data reader class to create an Array of Ext.data.Record objects from an Array. Each element of that Array represents a row of data fields. The fields are pulled into a Record object using as a subscript, the mapping property of the field definition if it exists, or the field's ordinal position in the definition.

Example code:. 

var Employee = Ext.data.Record.create([
    {name: 'name', mapping: 1},         // "mapping" only needed if an "id" field is present which
    {name: 'occupation', mapping: 2}    // precludes using the ordinal position as the index.
]);
var myReader = new Ext.data.ArrayReader({
    id: 0                     // The subscript within row Array that provides an ID for the Record (optional)
}, Employee);

This would consume an Array like this: 

[ [1, 'Bill', 'Gardener'], [2, 'Ben', 'Horticulturalist'] ]

parameter.name: meta
parameter.description: Metadata configuration options.

parameter.name: recordType
parameter.description: Either an Array of field definition objects as specified to Ext.data.Record.create, or a Record constructor created using Ext.data.Record.create.

method.name: readRecords
method.description: Create a data block containing Ext.data.Records from an Array.

parameter.name: o
parameter.description: An Array of row objects which represents the dataset.

class.description:
The class encapsulates a connection to the page's originating domain, allowing requests to be made either to a configured URL, or to a URL specified at request time.

Requests made by this class are asynchronous, and will return immediately. No data from the server will be available to the statement immediately following the request call. To process returned data, use a {@link #request-option-success callback} in the request options object, or an event listener.

{@link #request-option-isUpload File uploads} are not performed using normal "Ajax" techniques, that is they are not performed using XMLHttpRequests. Instead the form is submitted in the standard manner with the DOM <form> element temporarily modified to have its target set to refer to a dynamically generated, hidden <iframe> which is inserted into the document but removed after the return data has been gathered.

The server response is parsed by the browser to create the document for the IFRAME. If the server is using JSON to send the return object, then the Content-Type header must be set to "text/html" in order to tell the browser to insert the text unchanged into the document body.

The response text is retrieved from the document, and a fake XMLHttpRequest object is created containing a responseText property in order to conform to the requirements of event handlers and callbacks.

Be aware that file upload packets are sent with the content type multipart/form and some server technologies (notably JEE) may require some custom processing in order to retrieve parameter names and parameter values from the packet content.

parameter.name: config
parameter.description: a configuration object.

method.name: request
method.description:
Sends an HTTP request to a remote server.

Important: Ajax server requests are asynchronous, and this call will return before the response has been received. Process any returned data in a callback function.

To execute a callback function in the correct scope, use the scope option.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description:
An object which may contain the following properties:
  • url : String/Function (Optional)
    The URL to which to send the request, or a function to call which returns a URL string. The scope of the function is specified by the scope option. Defaults to configured URL.
  • params : Object/String/Function (Optional)
    An object containing properties which are used as parameters to the request, a url encoded string or a function to call to get either. The scope of the function is specified by the scope option.
  • method : String (Optional)
    The HTTP method to use for the request. Defaults to the configured method, or if no method was configured, "GET" if no parameters are being sent, and "POST" if parameters are being sent. Note that the method name is case-sensitive and should be all caps.
  • callback : Function (Optional)
    The function to be called upon receipt of the HTTP response. The callback is called regardless of success or failure and is passed the following parameters:
    • options : Object
      The parameter to the request call.
    • success : Boolean
      True if the request succeeded.
    • response : Object
      The XMLHttpRequest object containing the response data. See http://www.w3.org/TR/XMLHttpRequest/ for details about accessing elements of the response.
  • success : Function (Optional)
    The function to be called upon success of the request. The callback is passed the following parameters:
    • response : Object
      The XMLHttpRequest object containing the response data.
    • options : Object
      The parameter to the request call.
  • failure : Function (Optional)
    The function to be called upon failure of the request. The callback is passed the following parameters:
    • response : Object
      The XMLHttpRequest object containing the response data.
    • options : Object
      The parameter to the request call.
  • scope : Object (Optional)
    The scope in which to execute the callbacks: The "this" object for the callback function. If the url, or params options were specified as functions from which to draw values, then this also serves as the scope for those function calls. Defaults to the browser window.
  • form : Element/HTMLElement/String (Optional)
    The <form> Element or the id of the <form> to pull parameters from.
  • isUpload : Boolean (Optional)
    True if the form object is a file upload (will usually be automatically detected).

    File uploads are not performed using normal "Ajax" techniques, that is they are not performed using XMLHttpRequests. Instead the form is submitted in the standard manner with the DOM <form> element temporarily modified to have its target set to refer to a dynamically generated, hidden <iframe> which is inserted into the document but removed after the return data has been gathered.

    The server response is parsed by the browser to create the document for the IFRAME. If the server is using JSON to send the return object, then the Content-Type header must be set to "text/html" in order to tell the browser to insert the text unchanged into the document body.

    The response text is retrieved from the document, and a fake XMLHttpRequest object is created containing a responseText property in order to conform to the requirements of event handlers and callbacks.

    Be aware that file upload packets are sent with the content type multipart/form and some server technologies (notably JEE) may require some custom processing in order to retrieve parameter names and parameter values from the packet content.

  • headers : Object (Optional)
    Request headers to set for the request.
  • xmlData : Object (Optional)
    XML document to use for the post. Note: This will be used instead of params for the post data. Any params will be appended to the URL.
  • jsonData : Object/String (Optional)
    JSON data to use as the post. Note: This will be used instead of params for the post data. Any params will be appended to the URL.
  • disableCaching : Boolean (Optional)
    True to add a unique cache-buster param to GET requests.

The options object may also contain any other property which might be needed to perform postprocessing in a callback because it is passed to callback functions.

method.name: isLoading
method.description: Determine whether this object has a request outstanding.

parameter.name: transactionId
parameter.description: (Optional) defaults to the last transaction

method.name: abort
method.description: Aborts any outstanding request.

parameter.name: transactionId
parameter.description: (Optional) defaults to the last transaction

class.description:
This class is an abstract base class for implementations which provide retrieval of unformatted data objects.

DataProxy implementations are usually used in conjunction with an implementation of Ext.data.DataReader (of the appropriate type which knows how to parse the data object) to provide a block of Ext.data.Records to an Ext.data.Store.

Custom implementations must implement the load method as described in Ext.data.HttpProxy.load.

Abstract base class for reading structured data from a data source and converting it into an object containing Ext.data.Record objects and metadata for use by an Ext.data.Store. This class is intended to be extended and should not be created directly. For existing implementations, see Ext.data.ArrayReader, Ext.data.JsonReader and Ext.data.XmlReader.

parameter.name: meta
parameter.description: Metadata configuration options (implementation-specific)

parameter.name: recordType
parameter.description: Either an Array of field definition objects as specified in Ext.data.Record.create, or an Ext.data.Record object created using Ext.data.Record.create.

property.name: meta
property.description: This DataReader's configured metadata as passed to the constructor.

class.description: A specialized store implementation that provides for grouping records by one of the available fields.

parameter.name: config
parameter.description: A config object containing the objects needed for the Store to access data, and read the data into Records.

method.name: clearGrouping
method.description: Clears any existing grouping and refreshes the data using the default sort.

method.name: groupBy
method.description: Groups the data by the specified field.

parameter.name: field
parameter.description: The field name by which to sort the store's data

parameter.name: forceRegroup
parameter.description: (optional) True to force the group to be refreshed even if the field passed in is the same as the current grouping field, false to skip grouping on the same field (defaults to false)

class.description:
An implementation of Ext.data.DataProxy that reads a data object from a Connection object configured to reference a certain URL.

Note that this class cannot be used to retrieve data from a domain other than the domain from which the running page was served.

For cross-domain access to remote data, use a ScriptTagProxy.

Be aware that to enable the browser to parse an XML document, the server must set the Content-Type header in the HTTP response to "text/xml".

parameter.name: conn
parameter.description: an Ext.data.Connection object, or options parameter to Ext.Ajax.request. If an options parameter is passed, the singleton Ext.Ajax object will be used to make the request.

property.name: conn
property.description: The Connection object (Or options parameter to Ext.Ajax.request) which this HttpProxy uses to make requests to the server. Properties of this object may be changed dynamically to change the way data is requested.

method.name: getConnection
method.description: Return the Ext.data.Connection object being used by this Proxy.

method.name: load
method.description: Load data from the configured Ext.data.Connection, read the data object into a block of Ext.data.Records using the passed Ext.data.DataReader implementation, and process that block using the passed callback.

parameter.name: params
parameter.description: An object containing properties which are to be used as HTTP parameters for the request to the remote server.

parameter.name: reader
parameter.description: The Reader object which converts the data object into a block of Ext.data.Records.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.description:
The function into which to pass the block of Ext.data.Records. The function must be passed
  • The Record block object
  • The "arg" argument from the load function
  • A boolean success indicator

parameter.name: scope
parameter.description: The scope in which to call the callback

parameter.name: arg
parameter.description: An optional argument which is passed to the callback as its second parameter.

class.description:
Data reader class to create an Array of Ext.data.Record objects from a JSON response based on mappings in a provided Ext.data.Record constructor.

Example code: 

var Employee = Ext.data.Record.create([
    {name: 'firstname'},                  // Map the Record's "firstname" field to the row object's key of the same name
    {name: 'job', mapping: 'occupation'}  // Map the "job" field to the row object's "occupation" key
]);
var myReader = new Ext.data.JsonReader({
    totalProperty: "results",             // The property which contains the total dataset size (optional)
    root: "rows",                         // The property which contains an Array of row objects
    id: "id"                              // The property within each row object that provides an ID for the record (optional)
}, Employee);

This would consume a JSON object of the form: 

{
    'results': 2,
    'rows': [
        { 'id': 1, 'firstname': 'Bill', occupation: 'Gardener' },         // a row object
        { 'id': 2, 'firstname': 'Ben' , occupation: 'Horticulturalist' }  // another row object
    ]
}

It is possible to change a JsonReader's metadata at any time by including a metaData property in the data object. If this is detected in the object, a Store object using this Reader will fire its metachange event.

The metaData property may contain any of the configuration options for this class. Additionally, it may contain a fields property which the JsonReader will use as an argument to Ext.data.Record.create to configure the layout of the Records which it will produce.

Using the metaData property, and the Store's metachange event, it is possible to have a Store-driven control initialize itself. The metachange event handler may interrogate the metaData property (which may contain any user-defined properties needed) and the metaData.fields property to perform any configuration required.

To use this facility to send the same data as the above example without having to code the creation of the Record constructor, you would create the JsonReader like this:

var myReader = new Ext.data.JsonReader();

The first data packet from the server would configure the reader by containing a metaData property as well as the data:

{
  'metaData': {
    totalProperty: 'results',
    root: 'rows',
    id: 'id',
    fields: [
      {name: 'name'},
      {name: 'occupation'} ]
   },
  'results': 2, 'rows': [
    { 'id': 1, 'name': 'Bill', occupation: 'Gardener' },
    { 'id': 2, 'name': 'Ben', occupation: 'Horticulturalist' } ]
}

parameter.name: meta
parameter.description: Metadata configuration options.

parameter.name: recordType
parameter.description: Either an Array of field definition objects as passed to Ext.data.Record.create, or a Record constructor created using Ext.data.Record.create.

property.name: meta
property.description: This JsonReader's metadata as passed to the constructor, or as passed in the last data packet's metaData property.

property.name: jsonData
property.description: After any data loads, the raw JSON data is available for further custom processing. If no data is loaded or there is a load exception this property will be undefined.

method.name: read
method.description: This method is only used by a DataProxy which has retrieved data from a remote server.

parameter.name: response
parameter.description: The XHR object which contains the JSON data in its responseText.

method.name: readRecords
method.description: Create a data block containing Ext.data.Records from a JSON object.

parameter.name: o
parameter.description: An object which contains an Array of row objects in the property specified in the config as 'root, and optionally a property, specified in the config as 'totalProperty' which contains the total size of the dataset.

class.description: An implementation of Ext.data.DataProxy that simply passes the data specified in its constructor to the Reader when its load method is called.

parameter.name: data
parameter.description: The data object which the Reader uses to construct a block of Ext.data.Records.

method.name: load
method.description: Load data from the requested source (in this case an in-memory data object passed to the constructor), read the data object into a block of Ext.data.Records using the passed Ext.data.DataReader implementation, and process that block using the passed callback.

parameter.name: params
parameter.description: This parameter is not used by the MemoryProxy class.

parameter.name: reader
parameter.description: The Reader object which converts the data object into a block of Ext.data.Records.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.description:
The function into which to pass the block of Ext.data.records. The function must be passed
  • The Record block object
  • The "arg" argument from the load function
  • A boolean success indicator

parameter.name: scope
parameter.description: The scope in which to call the callback

parameter.name: arg
parameter.description: An optional argument which is passed to the callback as its second parameter.

parameter.name: attributes
parameter.description: The attributes/config for the node

property.name: attributes
property.description: The attributes supplied for the node. You can use this property to access any custom attributes you supplied.

property.name: id
property.description: The node id.

property.name: childNodes
property.description: All child nodes of this node.

property.name: parentNode
property.description: The parent node for this node.

property.name: firstChild
property.description: The first direct child node of this node, or null if this node has no child nodes.

property.name: lastChild
property.description: The last direct child node of this node, or null if this node has no child nodes.

property.name: previousSibling
property.description: The node immediately preceding this node in the tree, or null if there is no sibling node.

property.name: nextSibling
property.description: The node immediately following this node in the tree, or null if there is no sibling node.

method.name: isLeaf
method.description: Returns true if this node is a leaf

method.name: isLast
method.description: Returns true if this node is the last child of its parent

method.name: isFirst
method.description: Returns true if this node is the first child of its parent

method.name: hasChildNodes
method.description: Returns true if this node has one or more child nodes, else false.

method.name: isExpandable
method.description: Returns true if this node has one or more child nodes, or if the expandable node attribute is explicitly specified as true (see attributes), otherwise returns false.

method.name: appendChild
method.description: Insert node(s) as the last child node of this node.

parameter.name: node
parameter.description: The node or Array of nodes to append

method.name: removeChild
method.description: Removes a child node from this node.

parameter.name: node
parameter.description: The node to remove

method.name: insertBefore
method.description: Inserts the first node before the second node in this nodes childNodes collection.

parameter.name: node
parameter.description: The node to insert

parameter.name: refNode
parameter.description: The node to insert before (if null the node is appended)

method.name: remove
method.description: Removes this node from it's parent

method.name: item
method.description: Returns the child node at the specified index.

method.name: replaceChild
method.description: Replaces one child node in this node with another.

parameter.name: newChild
parameter.description: The replacement node

parameter.name: oldChild
parameter.description: The node to replace

method.name: indexOf
method.description: Returns the index of a child node

method.name: getOwnerTree
method.description: Returns the tree this node is in.

method.name: getDepth
method.description: Returns depth of this node (the root node has a depth of 0)

method.name: getPath
method.description: Returns the path for this node. The path can be used to expand or select this node programmatically.

parameter.name: attr
parameter.description: (optional) The attr to use for the path (defaults to the node's id)

method.name: bubble
method.description: Bubbles up the tree from this node, calling the specified function with each node. The scope (this) of function call will be the scope provided or the current node. The arguments to the function will be the args provided or the current node. If the function returns false at any point, the bubble is stopped.

parameter.name: fn
parameter.description: The function to call

parameter.name: scope
parameter.description: (optional) The scope of the function (defaults to current node)

parameter.name: args
parameter.description: (optional) The args to call the function with (default to passing the current node)

method.name: cascade
method.description: Cascades down the tree from this node, calling the specified function with each node. The scope (this) of function call will be the scope provided or the current node. The arguments to the function will be the args provided or the current node. If the function returns false at any point, the cascade is stopped on that branch.

parameter.name: fn
parameter.description: The function to call

parameter.name: scope
parameter.description: (optional) The scope of the function (defaults to current node)

parameter.name: args
parameter.description: (optional) The args to call the function with (default to passing the current node)

method.name: eachChild
method.description: Iterates the child nodes of this node, calling the specified function with each node. The scope (this) of function call will be the scope provided or the current node. The arguments to the function will be the args provided or the current node. If the function returns false at any point, the iteration stops.

parameter.name: fn
parameter.description: The function to call

parameter.name: scope
parameter.description: (optional) The scope of the function (defaults to current node)

parameter.name: args
parameter.description: (optional) The args to call the function with (default to passing the current node)

method.name: findChild
method.description: Finds the first child that has the attribute with the specified value.

parameter.name: attribute
parameter.description: The attribute name

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The value to search for

method.name: findChildBy
method.description: Finds the first child by a custom function. The child matches if the function passed returns true.

parameter.name: scope
parameter.description: (optional)

method.name: sort
method.description: Sorts this nodes children using the supplied sort function

parameter.name: scope
parameter.description: (optional)

method.name: contains
method.description: Returns true if this node is an ancestor (at any point) of the passed node.

method.name: isAncestor
method.description: Returns true if the passed node is an ancestor (at any point) of this node.

class.description:
Instances of this class encapsulate both Record definition information, and Record value information for use in Ext.data.Store objects, or any code which needs to access Records cached in an Ext.data.Store object.

Constructors for this class are generated by passing an Array of field definition objects to create. Instances are usually only created by Ext.data.Reader implementations when processing unformatted data objects.

Record objects generated by this constructor inherit all the methods of Ext.data.Record listed below.

constructor.description: This constructor should not be used to create Record objects. Instead, use the constructor generated by create. The parameters are the same.

parameter.name: data
parameter.description: An object, the properties of which provide values for the new Record's fields.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: (Optional) The id of the Record. This id should be unique, and is used by the Ext.data.Store object which owns the Record to index its collection of Records. If not specified an integer id is generated.

property.name: data
property.description: An object hash representing the data for this Record.

property.name: id
property.description: The unique ID of the Record as specified at construction time.

property.name: dirty
property.description: Readonly flag - true if this Record has been modified.

property.name: modified
property.description: This object contains a key and value storing the original values of all modified fields or is null if no fields have been modified.

method.name: create
method.description: <static> Generate a constructor for a specific Record layout.

parameter.name: o
parameter.description:
An Array of field definition objects which specify field names, and optionally, data types, and a mapping for an Ext.data.Reader to extract the field's value from a data object. Each field definition object may contain the following properties:
  • name : String
    The name by which the field is referenced within the Record. This is referenced by, for example, the dataIndex property in column definition objects passed to Ext.grid.ColumnModel
  • mapping : String
    (Optional) A path specification for use by the Ext.data.Reader implementation that is creating the Record to access the data value from the data object. If an Ext.data.JsonReader is being used, then this is a string containing the javascript expression to reference the data relative to the Record item's root. If an Ext.data.XmlReader is being used, this is an Ext.DomQuery path to the data item relative to the Record element. If the mapping expression is the same as the field name, this may be omitted.
  • type : String
    (Optional) The data type for conversion to displayable value. Possible values are
    • auto (Default, implies no conversion)
    • string
    • int
    • float
    • boolean
    • date
  • sortType : Mixed
    (Optional) A member of Ext.data.SortTypes.
  • sortDir : String
    (Optional) Initial direction to sort. "ASC" or "DESC"
  • convert : Function
    (Optional) A function which converts the value provided by the Reader into an object that will be stored in the Record. It is passed the following parameters:
    • v : Mixed
      The data value as read by the Reader.
    • rec : Mixed
      The data object containing the row as read by the Reader. Depending on Reader type, this could be an Array, an object, or an XML element.
  • dateFormat : String
    (Optional) A format String for the Date.parseDate function.
  • defaultValue : Mixed
    (Optional) The default value passed to the Reader when the field does not exist in the data object (i.e. undefined). (defaults to "")

usage:
var TopicRecord = Ext.data.Record.create([
    {name: 'title', mapping: 'topic_title'},
    {name: 'author', mapping: 'username'},
    {name: 'totalPosts', mapping: 'topic_replies', type: 'int'},
    {name: 'lastPost', mapping: 'post_time', type: 'date'},
    {name: 'lastPoster', mapping: 'user2'},
    {name: 'excerpt', mapping: 'post_text'}
]);

var myNewRecord = new TopicRecord({
    topic_title: 'Do my job please',
    username: 'noobie',
    topic_replies: 1,
    post_time: new Date(),
    user2: 'Animal',
    post_text: 'No way dude!'
});
myStore.add(myNewRecord);

In the simplest case, if no properties other than name are required, a field definition may consist of just a field name string.

method.name: set
method.description: Set the named field to the specified value.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the field to set.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The value to set the field to.

method.name: get
method.description: Get the value of the named field.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the field to get the value of.

method.name: beginEdit
method.description: Begin an edit. While in edit mode, no events are relayed to the containing store.

method.name: cancelEdit
method.description: Cancels all changes made in the current edit operation.

method.name: endEdit
method.description: End an edit. If any data was modified, the containing store is notified.

method.name: reject
method.description:
Usually called by the Ext.data.Store which owns the Record. Rejects all changes made to the Record since either creation, or the last commit operation. Modified fields are reverted to their original values.

Developers should subscribe to the Ext.data.Store.update event to have their code notified of reject operations.

parameter.name: silent
parameter.description: (optional) True to skip notification of the owning store of the change (defaults to false)

method.name: commit
method.description:
Usually called by the Ext.data.Store which owns the Record. Commits all changes made to the Record since either creation, or the last commit operation.

Developers should subscribe to the Ext.data.Store.update event to have their code notified of commit operations.

parameter.name: silent
parameter.description: (optional) True to skip notification of the owning store of the change (defaults to false)

method.name: getChanges
method.description: Gets a hash of only the fields that have been modified since this Record was created or commited.

method.name: copy
method.description: Creates a copy of this Record.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: (optional) A new Record id if you don't want to use this Record's id

method.name: isModified
method.description: Returns true if the field passed has been modified since the load or last commit.

parameter.name: config
parameter.description: A configuration object.

method.name: load
method.description: Load data from the configured URL, read the data object into a block of Ext.data.Records using the passed Ext.data.DataReader implementation, and process that block using the passed callback.

parameter.name: params
parameter.description: An object containing properties which are to be used as HTTP parameters for the request to the remote server.

parameter.name: reader
parameter.description: The Reader object which converts the data object into a block of Ext.data.Records.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.description:
The function into which to pass the block of Ext.data.Records. The function must be passed
  • The Record block object
  • The "arg" argument from the load function
  • A boolean success indicator

parameter.name: scope
parameter.description: The scope in which to call the callback

parameter.name: arg
parameter.description: An optional argument which is passed to the callback as its second parameter.

method.name: abort
method.description: Abort the current server request.

class.description: Small helper class to make creating Stores from Array data easier.
This class is a singleton and cannot be created directly.

property.name: stripTagsRE
property.description: The regular expression used to strip tags

method.name: none
method.description: Default sort that does nothing

parameter.name: s
parameter.description: The value being converted

method.name: asText
method.description: Strips all HTML tags to sort on text only

parameter.name: s
parameter.description: The value being converted

method.name: asUCText
method.description: Strips all HTML tags to sort on text only - Case insensitive

parameter.name: s
parameter.description: The value being converted

method.name: asUCString
method.description: Case insensitive string

parameter.name: s
parameter.description: The value being converted

method.name: asDate
method.description: Date sorting

parameter.name: s
parameter.description: The value being converted

method.name: asFloat
method.description: Float sorting

parameter.name: s
parameter.description: The value being converted

method.name: asInt
method.description: Integer sorting

parameter.name: s
parameter.description: The value being converted

class.description:
The Store class encapsulates a client side cache of Record objects which provide input data for Components such as the GridPanel, the ComboBox, or the DataView

A Store object uses its configured implementation of DataProxy to access a data object unless you call loadData directly and pass in your data.

A Store object has no knowledge of the format of the data returned by the Proxy.

A Store object uses its configured implementation of DataReader to create Record instances from the data object. These Records are cached and made available through accessor functions.

parameter.name: config
parameter.description: A config object containing the objects needed for the Store to access data, and read the data into Records.

property.name: baseParams
property.description: An object containing properties which are used as parameters on any HTTP request. This property can be changed after creating the Store to send different parameters.

property.name: lastOptions
property.description: Contains the last options object used as the parameter to the load method. See load for the details of what this may contain. This may be useful for accessing any params which were used to load the current Record cache.

method.name: add
method.description: Add Records to the Store and fires the add event.

parameter.name: records
parameter.description: An Array of Ext.data.Record objects to add to the cache.

method.name: addSorted
method.description: (Local sort only) Inserts the passed Record into the Store at the index where it should go based on the current sort information.

method.name: remove
method.description: Remove a Record from the Store and fires the remove event.

parameter.name: record
parameter.description: Th Ext.data.Record object to remove from the cache.

method.name: removeAll
method.description: Remove all Records from the Store and fires the clear event.

method.name: insert
method.description: Inserts Records into the Store at the given index and fires the add event.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: The start index at which to insert the passed Records.

parameter.name: records
parameter.description: An Array of Ext.data.Record objects to add to the cache.

method.name: indexOf
method.description: Get the index within the cache of the passed Record.

parameter.name: record
parameter.description: The Ext.data.Record object to find.

method.name: indexOfId
method.description: Get the index within the cache of the Record with the passed id.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: The id of the Record to find.

method.name: getById
method.description: Get the Record with the specified id.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: The id of the Record to find.

method.name: getAt
method.description: Get the Record at the specified index.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: The index of the Record to find.

method.name: getRange
method.description: Returns a range of Records between specified indices.

parameter.name: startIndex
parameter.description: (optional) The starting index (defaults to 0)

parameter.name: endIndex
parameter.description: (optional) The ending index (defaults to the last Record in the Store)

method.name: load
method.description:
Loads the Record cache from the configured Proxy using the configured Reader.

If using remote paging, then the first load call must specify the start and limit properties in the options.params property to establish the initial position within the dataset, and the number of Records to cache on each read from the Proxy.

It is important to note that for remote data sources, loading is asynchronous, and this call will return before the new data has been loaded. Perform any post-processing in a callback function, or in a "load" event handler.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description:
An object containing properties which control loading options:
  • params :Object

    An object containing properties to pass as HTTP parameters to a remote data source.

  • callback : Function

    A function to be called after the Records have been loaded. The callback is passed the following arguments:

    • r : Ext.data.Record[]
    • options: Options object from the load call
    • success: Boolean success indicator

  • scope : Object

    Scope with which to call the callback (defaults to the Store object)

  • add : Boolean

    Indicator to append loaded records rather than replace the current cache.

method.name: reload
method.description: Reloads the Record cache from the configured Proxy using the configured Reader and the options from the last load operation performed.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description: (optional) An object containing properties which may override the options used in the last load operation. See load for details (defaults to null, in which case the most recently used options are reused).

method.name: loadData
method.description: Loads data from a passed data block and fires the load event. A Reader which understands the format of the data must have been configured in the constructor.

parameter.name: data
parameter.description: The data block from which to read the Records. The format of the data expected is dependent on the type of Reader that is configured and should correspond to that Reader's readRecords parameter.

parameter.name: append
parameter.description: (Optional) True to append the new Records rather than replace the existing cache.

method.name: getCount
method.description:
Gets the number of cached records.

If using paging, this may not be the total size of the dataset. If the data object used by the Reader contains the dataset size, then the getTotalCount function returns the dataset size.

method.name: getTotalCount
method.description:
Gets the total number of records in the dataset as returned by the server.

If using paging, for this to be accurate, the data object used by the Reader must contain the dataset size. For remote data sources, this is provided by a query on the server.

method.name: getSortState
method.description: Returns an object describing the current sort state of this Store.

method.name: setDefaultSort
method.description: Sets the default sort column and order to be used by the next load operation.

parameter.name: fieldName
parameter.description: The name of the field to sort by.

parameter.name: dir
parameter.description: (optional) The sort order, "ASC" or "DESC" (case-sensitive, defaults to "ASC")

method.name: sort
method.description: Sort the Records. If remote sorting is used, the sort is performed on the server, and the cache is reloaded. If local sorting is used, the cache is sorted internally.

parameter.name: fieldName
parameter.description: The name of the field to sort by.

parameter.name: dir
parameter.description: (optional) The sort order, "ASC" or "DESC" (case-sensitive, defaults to "ASC")

method.name: each
method.description: Calls the specified function for each of the Records in the cache.

parameter.name: fn
parameter.description: The function to call. The Record is passed as the first parameter. Returning <tt>false</tt> aborts and exits the iteration.

parameter.name: scope
parameter.description: (optional) The scope in which to call the function (defaults to the Record).

method.name: getModifiedRecords
method.description: Gets all records modified since the last commit. Modified records are persisted across load operations (e.g., during paging).

method.name: sum
method.description: Sums the value of property for each record between start and end and returns the result.

parameter.name: property
parameter.description: A field on your records

parameter.name: start
parameter.description: The record index to start at (defaults to 0)

parameter.name: end
parameter.description: The last record index to include (defaults to length - 1)

method.name: filter
method.description: Filter the records by a specified property.

parameter.name: field
parameter.description: A field on your records

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: Either a string that the field should begin with, or a RegExp to test against the field.

parameter.name: anyMatch
parameter.description: (optional) True to match any part not just the beginning

parameter.name: caseSensitive
parameter.description: (optional) True for case sensitive comparison

method.name: filterBy
method.description: Filter by a function. The specified function will be called for each Record in this Store. If the function returns <tt>true</tt> the Record is included, otherwise it is filtered out.

parameter.name: fn
parameter.description:
The function to be called. It will be passed the following parameters:
  • record : Ext.data.Record

    The record to test for filtering. Access field values using Ext.data.Record.get.

  • id : Object

    The ID of the Record passed.

parameter.name: scope
parameter.description: (optional) The scope of the function (defaults to this)

method.name: query
method.description: Query the records by a specified property.

parameter.name: field
parameter.description: A field on your records

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: Either a string that the field should begin with, or a RegExp to test against the field.

parameter.name: anyMatch
parameter.description: (optional) True to match any part not just the beginning

parameter.name: caseSensitive
parameter.description: (optional) True for case sensitive comparison

method.name: queryBy
method.description: Query the cached records in this Store using a filtering function. The specified function will be called with each record in this Store. If the function returns <tt>true</tt> the record is included in the results.

parameter.name: fn
parameter.description:
The function to be called. It will be passed the following parameters:
  • record : Ext.data.Record

    The record to test for filtering. Access field values using Ext.data.Record.get.

  • id : Object

    The ID of the Record passed.

parameter.name: scope
parameter.description: (optional) The scope of the function (defaults to this)

method.name: find
method.description: Finds the index of the first matching record in this store by a specific property/value.

parameter.name: property
parameter.description: A property on your objects

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: Either a string that the property value should begin with, or a RegExp to test against the property.

parameter.name: startIndex
parameter.description: (optional) The index to start searching at

parameter.name: anyMatch
parameter.description: (optional) True to match any part of the string, not just the beginning

parameter.name: caseSensitive
parameter.description: (optional) True for case sensitive comparison

method.name: findBy
method.description: Find the index of the first matching Record in this Store by a function. If the function returns <tt>true</tt> it is considered a match.

parameter.name: fn
parameter.description:
The function to be called. It will be passed the following parameters:
  • record : Ext.data.Record

    The record to test for filtering. Access field values using Ext.data.Record.get.

  • id : Object

    The ID of the Record passed.

parameter.name: scope
parameter.description: (optional) The scope of the function (defaults to this)

parameter.name: startIndex
parameter.description: (optional) The index to start searching at

method.name: collect
method.description: Collects unique values for a particular dataIndex from this store.

parameter.name: dataIndex
parameter.description: The property to collect

parameter.name: allowNull
parameter.description: (optional) Pass true to allow null, undefined or empty string values

parameter.name: bypassFilter
parameter.description: (optional) Pass true to collect from all records, even ones which are filtered

method.name: clearFilter
method.description: Revert to a view of the Record cache with no filtering applied.

parameter.name: suppressEvent
parameter.description: If true the filter is cleared silently without notifying listeners

method.name: isFiltered
method.description: Returns true if this store is currently filtered

method.name: commitChanges
method.description: Commit all Records with outstanding changes. To handle updates for changes, subscribe to the Store's "update" event, and perform updating when the third parameter is Ext.data.Record.COMMIT.

method.name: rejectChanges
method.description: Cancel outstanding changes on all changed records.

class.description: Represents a tree data structure and bubbles all the events for its nodes. The nodes in the tree have most standard DOM functionality.

parameter.name: root
parameter.description: (optional) The root node

property.name: root
property.description: The root node for this tree

method.name: getRootNode
method.description: Returns the root node for this tree.

method.name: setRootNode
method.description: Sets the root node for this tree.

method.name: getNodeById
method.description: Gets a node in this tree by its id.

class.description:
Data reader class to create an Array of Ext.data.Record objects from an XML document based on mappings in a provided Ext.data.Record constructor.

Note that in order for the browser to parse a returned XML document, the Content-Type header in the HTTP response must be set to "text/xml" or "application/xml".

Example code: 

var Employee = Ext.data.Record.create([
   {name: 'name', mapping: 'name'},     // "mapping" property not needed if it's the same as "name"
   {name: 'occupation'}                 // This field will use "occupation" as the mapping.
]);
var myReader = new Ext.data.XmlReader({
   totalRecords: "results", // The element which contains the total dataset size (optional)
   record: "row",           // The repeated element which contains row information
   id: "id"                 // The element within the row that provides an ID for the record (optional)
}, Employee);

This would consume an XML file like this: 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<dataset>
 <results>2</results>
 <row>
   <id>1</id>
   <name>Bill</name>
   <occupation>Gardener</occupation>
 </row>
 <row>
   <id>2</id>
   <name>Ben</name>
   <occupation>Horticulturalist</occupation>
 </row>
</dataset>

parameter.name: meta
parameter.description: Metadata configuration options

parameter.name: recordType
parameter.description: Either an Array of field definition objects as passed to Ext.data.Record.create, or a Record constructor object created using Ext.data.Record.create.

property.name: xmlData
property.description: After any data loads/reads, the raw XML Document is available for further custom processing.

method.name: read
method.description: This method is only used by a DataProxy which has retrieved data from a remote server.

parameter.name: response
parameter.description: The XHR object which contains the parsed XML document. The response is expected to contain a property called <tt>responseXML</tt> which refers to an XML document object.

method.name: readRecords
method.description: Create a data block containing Ext.data.Records from an XML document.

parameter.name: doc
parameter.description: A parsed XML document.

class.description: A DragDrop implementation where the linked element follows the mouse cursor during a drag.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: the id of the linked element

parameter.name: sGroup
parameter.description: the group of related DragDrop items

parameter.name: config
parameter.description: an object containing configurable attributes Valid properties for DD: scroll

property.name: scroll
property.description: When set to true, the utility automatically tries to scroll the browser window when a drag and drop element is dragged near the viewport boundary. Defaults to true.

method.name: autoOffset
method.description: Sets the pointer offset to the distance between the linked element's top left corner and the location the element was clicked

parameter.name: iPageX
parameter.description: the X coordinate of the click

parameter.name: iPageY
parameter.description: the Y coordinate of the click

method.name: setDelta
method.description: Sets the pointer offset. You can call this directly to force the offset to be in a particular location (e.g., pass in 0,0 to set it to the center of the object)

parameter.description: the distance from the left

parameter.name: iDeltaY
parameter.description: the distance from the top

method.name: setDragElPos
method.description: Sets the drag element to the location of the mousedown or click event, maintaining the cursor location relative to the location on the element that was clicked. Override this if you want to place the element in a location other than where the cursor is.

parameter.name: iPageX
parameter.description: the X coordinate of the mousedown or drag event

parameter.name: iPageY
parameter.description: the Y coordinate of the mousedown or drag event

method.name: alignElWithMouse
method.description: Sets the element to the location of the mousedown or click event, maintaining the cursor location relative to the location on the element that was clicked. Override this if you want to place the element in a location other than where the cursor is.

parameter.name: el
parameter.description: the element to move

parameter.name: iPageX
parameter.description: the X coordinate of the mousedown or drag event

parameter.name: iPageY
parameter.description: the Y coordinate of the mousedown or drag event

method.name: cachePosition
method.description: Saves the most recent position so that we can reset the constraints and tick marks on-demand. We need to know this so that we can calculate the number of pixels the element is offset from its original position.

parameter.name: the
parameter.description: current x position (optional, this just makes it so we don't have to look it up again)

parameter.name: the
parameter.description: current y position (optional, this just makes it so we don't have to look it up again)

method.name: applyConfig
method.description: Sets up config options specific to this class. Overrides Ext.dd.DragDrop, but all versions of this method through the inheritance chain are called

method.name: b4MouseDown
method.description: Event that fires prior to the onMouseDown event. Overrides Ext.dd.DragDrop.

method.name: b4Drag
method.description: Event that fires prior to the onDrag event. Overrides Ext.dd.DragDrop.

class.description: A DragDrop implementation that inserts an empty, bordered div into the document that follows the cursor during drag operations. At the time of the click, the frame div is resized to the dimensions of the linked html element, and moved to the exact location of the linked element. References to the "frame" element refer to the single proxy element that was created to be dragged in place of all DDProxy elements on the page.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: the id of the linked html element

parameter.name: sGroup
parameter.description: the group of related DragDrop objects

parameter.name: config
parameter.description: an object containing configurable attributes Valid properties for DDProxy in addition to those in DragDrop: resizeFrame, centerFrame, dragElId

property.name: DDProxy.dragElId
property.description: <static> The default drag frame div id

property.name: resizeFrame
property.description: By default we resize the drag frame to be the same size as the element we want to drag (this is to get the frame effect). We can turn it off if we want a different behavior.

property.name: centerFrame
property.description: By default the frame is positioned exactly where the drag element is, so we use the cursor offset provided by Ext.dd.DD. Another option that works only if you do not have constraints on the obj is to have the drag frame centered around the cursor. Set centerFrame to true for this effect.

method.name: createFrame
method.description: Creates the proxy element if it does not yet exist

method.name: initFrame
method.description: Initialization for the drag frame element. Must be called in the constructor of all subclasses

class.description: A DragDrop implementation that does not move, but can be a drop target. You would get the same result by simply omitting implementation for the event callbacks, but this way we reduce the processing cost of the event listener and the callbacks.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: the id of the element that is a drop target

parameter.name: sGroup
parameter.description: the group of related DragDrop objects

parameter.name: config
parameter.description: an object containing configurable attributes Valid properties for DDTarget in addition to those in DragDrop: none

class.description:
Defines the interface and base operation of items that that can be dragged or can be drop targets. It was designed to be extended, overriding the event handlers for startDrag, onDrag, onDragOver and onDragOut. Up to three html elements can be associated with a DragDrop instance:
  • linked element: the element that is passed into the constructor. This is the element which defines the boundaries for interaction with other DragDrop objects.
  • handle element(s): The drag operation only occurs if the element that was clicked matches a handle element. By default this is the linked element, but there are times that you will want only a portion of the linked element to initiate the drag operation, and the setHandleElId() method provides a way to define this.
  • drag element: this represents the element that would be moved along with the cursor during a drag operation. By default, this is the linked element itself as in Ext.dd.DD. setDragElId() lets you define a separate element that would be moved, as in Ext.dd.DDProxy.
This class should not be instantiated until the onload event to ensure that the associated elements are available. The following would define a DragDrop obj that would interact with any other DragDrop obj in the "group1" group: 
dd = new Ext.dd.DragDrop("div1", "group1");
Since none of the event handlers have been implemented, nothing would actually happen if you were to run the code above. Normally you would override this class or one of the default implementations, but you can also override the methods you want on an instance of the class... 
dd.onDragDrop = function(e, id) {
  alert("dd was dropped on " + id);
}

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: of the element that is linked to this instance

parameter.name: sGroup
parameter.description: the group of related DragDrop objects

parameter.name: config
parameter.description: an object containing configurable attributes Valid properties for DragDrop: padding, isTarget, maintainOffset, primaryButtonOnly

property.name: id
property.description: The id of the element associated with this object. This is what we refer to as the "linked element" because the size and position of this element is used to determine when the drag and drop objects have interacted.

property.name: config
property.description: Configuration attributes passed into the constructor

property.name: invalidHandleTypes
invalidHandleIds
invalidHandleClasses
property.description: An Array of CSS class names for elements to be considered in valid as drag handles.

property.name: groups
property.description: The group defines a logical collection of DragDrop objects that are related. Instances only get events when interacting with other DragDrop object in the same group. This lets us define multiple groups using a single DragDrop subclass if we want.

property.name: isTarget
property.description: By default, all insances can be a drop target. This can be disabled by setting isTarget to false.

property.name: padding
property.description: The padding configured for this drag and drop object for calculating the drop zone intersection with this object.

property.name: maintainOffset
property.description: Maintain offsets when we resetconstraints. Set to true when you want the position of the element relative to its parent to stay the same when the page changes

property.name: xTicks
property.description: Array of pixel locations the element will snap to if we specified a horizontal graduation/interval. This array is generated automatically when you define a tick interval.

property.name: yTicks
property.description: Array of pixel locations the element will snap to if we specified a vertical graduation/interval. This array is generated automatically when you define a tick interval.

property.name: primaryButtonOnly
property.description: By default the drag and drop instance will only respond to the primary button click (left button for a right-handed mouse). Set to true to allow drag and drop to start with any mouse click that is propogated by the browser

property.name: available
property.description: The availabe property is false until the linked dom element is accessible.

property.name: hasOuterHandles
property.description: By default, drags can only be initiated if the mousedown occurs in the region the linked element is. This is done in part to work around a bug in some browsers that mis-report the mousedown if the previous mouseup happened outside of the window. This property is set to true if outer handles are defined.

property.name: defaultPadding
property.description: Provides default constraint padding to "constrainTo" elements (defaults to {left: 0, right:0, top:0, bottom:0}).

method.name: lock
method.description: Lock this instance

method.name: unlock
method.description: Unlock this instace

method.name: startDrag
method.description: Abstract method called after a drag/drop object is clicked and the drag or mousedown time thresholds have beeen met.

parameter.name: X
parameter.description: click location

parameter.name: Y
parameter.description: click location

method.name: onDrag
method.description: Abstract method called during the onMouseMove event while dragging an object.

parameter.name: e
parameter.description: the mousemove event

method.name: onDragEnter
method.description: Abstract method called when this element fist begins hovering over another DragDrop obj

parameter.name: e
parameter.description: the mousemove event

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: In POINT mode, the element id this is hovering over. In INTERSECT mode, an array of one or more dragdrop items being hovered over.

method.name: onDragOver
method.description: Abstract method called when this element is hovering over another DragDrop obj

parameter.name: e
parameter.description: the mousemove event

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: In POINT mode, the element id this is hovering over. In INTERSECT mode, an array of dd items being hovered over.

method.name: onDragOut
method.description: Abstract method called when we are no longer hovering over an element

parameter.name: e
parameter.description: the mousemove event

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: In POINT mode, the element id this was hovering over. In INTERSECT mode, an array of dd items that the mouse is no longer over.

method.name: onDragDrop
method.description: Abstract method called when this item is dropped on another DragDrop obj

parameter.name: e
parameter.description: the mouseup event

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: In POINT mode, the element id this was dropped on. In INTERSECT mode, an array of dd items this was dropped on.

method.name: onInvalidDrop
method.description: Abstract method called when this item is dropped on an area with no drop target

parameter.name: e
parameter.description: the mouseup event

method.name: endDrag
method.description: Fired when we are done dragging the object

parameter.name: e
parameter.description: the mouseup event

method.name: onMouseDown
method.description: Event handler that fires when a drag/drop obj gets a mousedown

parameter.name: e
parameter.description: the mousedown event

method.name: onMouseUp
method.description: Event handler that fires when a drag/drop obj gets a mouseup

parameter.name: e
parameter.description: the mouseup event

method.name: onAvailable
method.description: Override the onAvailable method to do what is needed after the initial position was determined.

method.name: constrainTo

parameter.name: constrainTo
parameter.description: The element to constrain to.

parameter.name: pad
inContent
parameter.description: (optional) Constrain the draggable in the content box of the element (inside padding and borders)

method.name: getEl
method.description: Returns a reference to the linked element

method.name: getDragEl
method.description: Returns a reference to the actual element to drag. By default this is the same as the html element, but it can be assigned to another element. An example of this can be found in Ext.dd.DDProxy

method.name: init
method.description: Sets up the DragDrop object. Must be called in the constructor of any Ext.dd.DragDrop subclass

parameter.name: the
parameter.description: id of the linked element

parameter.name: sGroup
parameter.description: the group of related items

parameter.name: config
parameter.description: configuration attributes

method.name: initTarget
method.description: Initializes Targeting functionality only... the object does not get a mousedown handler.

parameter.name: the
parameter.description: id of the linked element

parameter.name: sGroup
parameter.description: the group of related items

parameter.name: config
parameter.description: configuration attributes

method.name: applyConfig
method.description: Applies the configuration parameters that were passed into the constructor. This is supposed to happen at each level through the inheritance chain. So a DDProxy implentation will execute apply config on DDProxy, DD, and DragDrop in order to get all of the parameters that are available in each object.

method.name: setPadding
method.description: Configures the padding for the target zone in px. Effectively expands (or reduces) the virtual object size for targeting calculations. Supports css-style shorthand; if only one parameter is passed, all sides will have that padding, and if only two are passed, the top and bottom will have the first param, the left and right the second.

parameter.name: iTop
parameter.description: Top pad

parameter.name: iRight
parameter.description: Right pad

parameter.name: iBot
parameter.description: Bot pad

parameter.name: iLeft
parameter.description: Left pad

method.name: setInitialPosition
method.description: Stores the initial placement of the linked element.

parameter.name: diffX
parameter.description: the X offset, default 0

parameter.name: diffY
parameter.description: the Y offset, default 0

method.name: addToGroup
method.description: Add this instance to a group of related drag/drop objects. All instances belong to at least one group, and can belong to as many groups as needed.

parameter.name: {string}
parameter.description: the name of the group

method.name: removeFromGroup
method.description: Remove's this instance from the supplied interaction group

parameter.name: sGroup
parameter.description: The group to drop

method.name: setDragElId
method.description: Allows you to specify that an element other than the linked element will be moved with the cursor during a drag

parameter.name: {string}
parameter.description: the id of the element that will be used to initiate the drag

method.name: setHandleElId
method.description: Allows you to specify a child of the linked element that should be used to initiate the drag operation. An example of this would be if you have a content div with text and links. Clicking anywhere in the content area would normally start the drag operation. Use this method to specify that an element inside of the content div is the element that starts the drag operation.

parameter.name: {string}
parameter.description: the id of the element that will be used to initiate the drag.

method.name: setOuterHandleElId
method.description: Allows you to set an element outside of the linked element as a drag handle

parameter.name: the
parameter.description: id of the element that will be used to initiate the drag

method.name: unreg
method.description: Remove all drag and drop hooks for this element

method.name: isLocked
method.description: Returns true if this instance is locked, or the drag drop mgr is locked (meaning that all drag/drop is disabled on the page.)

method.name: addInvalidHandleType
method.description: Allows you to specify a tag name that should not start a drag operation when clicked. This is designed to facilitate embedding links within a drag handle that do something other than start the drag.

parameter.name: tagName
parameter.description: the type of element to exclude

method.name: addInvalidHandleId
method.description: Lets you to specify an element id for a child of a drag handle that should not initiate a drag

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: the element id of the element you wish to ignore

method.name: addInvalidHandleClass
method.description: Lets you specify a css class of elements that will not initiate a drag

parameter.name: cssClass
parameter.description: the class of the elements you wish to ignore

method.name: removeInvalidHandleType
method.description: Unsets an excluded tag name set by addInvalidHandleType

parameter.name: tagName
parameter.description: the type of element to unexclude

method.name: removeInvalidHandleId
method.description: Unsets an invalid handle id

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: the id of the element to re-enable

method.name: removeInvalidHandleClass
method.description: Unsets an invalid css class

parameter.name: cssClass
parameter.description: the class of the element(s) you wish to re-enable

method.name: isValidHandleChild
method.description: Checks the tag exclusion list to see if this click should be ignored

parameter.name: node
parameter.description: the HTMLElement to evaluate

method.name: setXConstraint
method.description: By default, the element can be dragged any place on the screen. Use this method to limit the horizontal travel of the element. Pass in 0,0 for the parameters if you want to lock the drag to the y axis.

parameter.name: iLeft
parameter.description: the number of pixels the element can move to the left

parameter.name: iRight
parameter.description: the number of pixels the element can move to the right

parameter.name: iTickSize
parameter.description: optional parameter for specifying that the element should move iTickSize pixels at a time.

method.name: clearConstraints
method.description: Clears any constraints applied to this instance. Also clears ticks since they can't exist independent of a constraint at this time.

method.name: clearTicks
method.description: Clears any tick interval defined for this instance

method.name: setYConstraint
method.description: By default, the element can be dragged any place on the screen. Set this to limit the vertical travel of the element. Pass in 0,0 for the parameters if you want to lock the drag to the x axis.

parameter.name: iUp
parameter.description: the number of pixels the element can move up

parameter.name: iDown
parameter.description: the number of pixels the element can move down

parameter.name: iTickSize
parameter.description: optional parameter for specifying that the element should move iTickSize pixels at a time.

method.name: resetConstraints
method.description: resetConstraints must be called if you manually reposition a dd element.

method.name: toString
method.description: toString method

class.description:
DragDropMgr is a singleton that tracks the element interaction for all DragDrop items in the window. Generally, you will not call this class directly, but it does have helper methods that could be useful in your DragDrop implementations.

This class is a singleton and cannot be created directly.

property.name: preventDefault
property.description: <static> Flag to determine if we should prevent the default behavior of the events we define. By default this is true, but this can be set to false if you need the default behavior (not recommended)

property.name: stopPropagation
property.description: <static> Flag to determine if we should stop the propagation of the events we generate. This is true by default but you may want to set it to false if the html element contains other features that require the mouse click.

property.name: POINT
property.description: <static> In point mode, drag and drop interaction is defined by the location of the cursor during the drag/drop

property.name: INTERSECT
property.description: <static> In intersect mode, drag and drop interaction is defined by the overlap of two or more drag and drop objects.

property.name: mode
property.description: <static> The current drag and drop mode. Default: POINT

property.name: useCache
property.description: <static> Set useCache to false if you want to force object the lookup of each drag and drop linked element constantly during a drag.

property.name: clickPixelThresh
property.description: <static> The number of pixels that the mouse needs to move after the mousedown before the drag is initiated. Default=3;

property.name: clickTimeThresh
property.description: <static> The number of milliseconds after the mousedown event to initiate the drag if we don't get a mouseup event. Default=1000

property.name: el
property.description: The element

property.name: id
property.description: The element id

property.name: css
property.description: A reference to the style property

method.name: lock
method.description: <static> Lock all drag and drop functionality

method.name: unlock
method.description: <static> Unlock all drag and drop functionality

method.name: isLocked
method.description: <static> Is drag and drop locked?

method.name: regDragDrop
method.description: <static> Each DragDrop instance must be registered with the DragDropMgr. This is executed in DragDrop.init()

parameter.name: oDD
parameter.description: the DragDrop object to register

parameter.name: sGroup
parameter.description: the name of the group this element belongs to

method.name: regHandle
method.description: <static> Each DragDrop handle element must be registered. This is done automatically when executing DragDrop.setHandleElId()

parameter.name: sDDId
parameter.description: the DragDrop id this element is a handle for

parameter.name: sHandleId
parameter.description: the id of the element that is the drag handle

method.name: isDragDrop
method.description: <static> Utility function to determine if a given element has been registered as a drag drop item.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: the element id to check

method.name: getRelated
method.description: <static> Returns the drag and drop instances that are in all groups the passed in instance belongs to.

parameter.name: p_oDD
parameter.description: the obj to get related data for

parameter.name: bTargetsOnly
parameter.description: if true, only return targetable objs

method.name: isLegalTarget
method.description: <static> Returns true if the specified dd target is a legal target for the specifice drag obj

parameter.name: the
parameter.description: drag obj

parameter.name: the
parameter.description: target

method.name: isTypeOfDD
method.description: <static> My goal is to be able to transparently determine if an object is typeof DragDrop, and the exact subclass of DragDrop. typeof returns "object", oDD.constructor.toString() always returns "DragDrop" and not the name of the subclass. So for now it just evaluates a well-known variable in DragDrop.

parameter.name: the
parameter.description: object to evaluate

method.name: isHandle
method.description: <static> Utility function to determine if a given element has been registered as a drag drop handle for the given Drag Drop object.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: the element id to check

method.name: getDDById
method.description: <static> Returns the DragDrop instance for a given id

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: the id of the DragDrop object

method.name: startDrag
method.description: <static> Fired when either the drag pixel threshol or the mousedown hold time threshold has been met.

parameter.name: {int}
parameter.description: the X position of the original mousedown

parameter.name: {int}
parameter.description: the Y position of the original mousedown

method.name: stopEvent
method.description: <static> Utility to stop event propagation and event default, if these features are turned on.

parameter.name: e
parameter.description: the event as returned by this.getEvent()

method.name: getBestMatch
method.description: <static> Helper function for getting the best match from the list of drag and drop objects returned by the drag and drop events when we are in INTERSECT mode. It returns either the first object that the cursor is over, or the object that has the greatest overlap with the dragged element.

parameter.name: dds
parameter.description: The array of drag and drop objects targeted

method.name: refreshCache
method.description: <static> Refreshes the cache of the top-left and bottom-right points of the drag and drop objects in the specified group(s). This is in the format that is stored in the drag and drop instance, so typical usage is: Ext.dd.DragDropMgr.refreshCache(ddinstance.groups); Alternatively: Ext.dd.DragDropMgr.refreshCache({group1:true, group2:true}); @TODO this really should be an indexed array. Alternatively this method could accept both.

parameter.name: groups
parameter.description: an associative array of groups to refresh

method.name: verifyEl
method.description: <static> This checks to make sure an element exists and is in the DOM. The main purpose is to handle cases where innerHTML is used to remove drag and drop objects from the DOM. IE provides an 'unspecified error' when trying to access the offsetParent of such an element

parameter.name: el

parameter.name: the
parameter.description: element for which to get the position

method.name: getPosY
method.description: Deprecated. <static> Returns the Y position of an html element

parameter.name: the
parameter.description: element for which to get the position

method.description: <static> Swap two nodes. In IE, we use the native method, for others we emulate the IE behavior

parameter.name: the
parameter.description: first node to swap

parameter.name: the
parameter.description: other node to swap

method.name: getStyle
method.description: Deprecated. <static> Returns the specified element style property

parameter.name: el

parameter.name: styleProp
parameter.description: the style property

method.name: getScrollTop
method.description: <static> Gets the scrollTop

method.name: getScrollLeft

method.description: <static> Sets the x/y position of an element to the location of the target element.

parameter.name: moveEl
parameter.description: The element to move

parameter.name: targetEl
parameter.description: The position reference element

method.name: numericSort
method.description: <static> Numeric array sort function

method.name: handleWasClicked
method.description: <static> Recursively searches the immediate parent and all child nodes for the handle element in order to determine wheter or not it was clicked.

parameter.name: the
parameter.description: html element to inspect
