class.description:
Utility class for manipulating CSS rules

This class is a singleton and cannot be created directly.

method.name: createStyleSheet
method.description: Creates a stylesheet from a text blob of rules. These rules will be wrapped in a STYLE tag and appended to the HEAD of the document.

parameter.name: cssText
parameter.description: The text containing the css rules

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: An id to add to the stylesheet for later removal

method.name: removeStyleSheet
method.description: Removes a style or link tag by id

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: The id of the tag

method.name: swapStyleSheet
method.description: Dynamically swaps an existing stylesheet reference for a new one

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: The id of an existing link tag to remove

parameter.name: url
parameter.description: The href of the new stylesheet to include

method.name: refreshCache
method.description: Refresh the rule cache if you have dynamically added stylesheets

method.name: getRules
method.description: Gets all css rules for the document

parameter.name: refreshCache
parameter.description: true to refresh the internal cache

method.name: getRule
method.description: Gets an an individual CSS rule by selector(s)

parameter.name: selector
parameter.description: The CSS selector or an array of selectors to try. The first selector that is found is returned.

parameter.name: refreshCache
parameter.description: true to refresh the internal cache if you have recently updated any rules or added styles dynamically

method.name: updateRule
method.description: Updates a rule property

parameter.name: selector
parameter.description: If it's an array it tries each selector until it finds one. Stops immediately once one is found.

parameter.name: property
parameter.description: The css property

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The new value for the property

class.description:
A wrapper class which can be applied to any element. Fires a "click" event while the mouse is pressed. The interval between firings may be specified in the config but defaults to 20 milliseconds.
Optionally, a CSS class may be applied to the element during the time it is pressed.

parameter.name: el
parameter.description: The element to listen on

class.description: Provides a convenient method of performing setTimeout where a new timeout cancels the old timeout. An example would be performing validation on a keypress. You can use this class to buffer the keypress events for a certain number of milliseconds, and perform only if they stop for that amount of time.

constructor.description: The parameters to this constructor serve as defaults and are not required.

parameter.name: fn
parameter.description: (optional) The default function to timeout

parameter.name: scope
parameter.description: (optional) The default scope of that timeout

parameter.name: args
parameter.description: (optional) The default Array of arguments

method.name: delay
method.description: Cancels any pending timeout and queues a new one

parameter.name: delay
parameter.description: The milliseconds to delay

parameter.name: newFn
parameter.description: (optional) Overrides function passed to constructor

parameter.name: newScope
parameter.description: (optional) Overrides scope passed to constructor

parameter.name: newArgs
parameter.description: (optional) Overrides args passed to constructor

method.name: cancel
method.description: Cancel the last queued timeout

class.description:
Modified version of Douglas Crockford"s json.js that doesn"t mess with the Object prototype http://www.json.org/js.html

This class is a singleton and cannot be created directly.

method.name: encode
method.description: Encodes an Object, Array or other value

parameter.name: o
parameter.description: The variable to encode

method.name: decode
method.description: Decodes (parses) a JSON string to an object. If the JSON is invalid, this function throws a SyntaxError.

parameter.name: json
parameter.description: The JSON string

class.description: A Collection class that maintains both numeric indexes and keys and exposes events.

parameter.name: allowFunctions
parameter.description: True if the addAll function should add function references to the collection (defaults to false)

parameter.name: keyFn
parameter.description: A function that can accept an item of the type(s) stored in this MixedCollection and return the key value for that item. This is used when available to look up the key on items that were passed without an explicit key parameter to a MixedCollection method. Passing this parameter is equivalent to providing an implementation for the getKey method.

method.name: add
method.description: Adds an item to the collection. Fires the add event when complete.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description:
The key to associate with the item, or the new item.

If you supplied a getKey implementation for this MixedCollection, or if the key of your stored items is in a property called id, then the MixedCollection will be able to derive the key for the new item. In this case just pass the new item in this parameter.

parameter.name: o
parameter.description: The item to add.

method.name: getKey

parameter.name: item
parameter.description: The item for which to find the key.

method.name: replace
method.description: Replaces an item in the collection. Fires the replace event when complete.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description:
The key associated with the item to replace, or the replacement item.

If you supplied a getKey implementation for this MixedCollection, or if the key of your stored items is in a property called id, then the MixedCollection will be able to derive the key of the replacement item. If you want to replace an item with one having the same key value, then just pass the replacement item in this parameter.

parameter.name: {Object}
parameter.description: o (optional) If the first parameter passed was a key, the item to associate with that key.

method.name: addAll
method.description: Adds all elements of an Array or an Object to the collection.

parameter.name: objs
parameter.description: An Object containing properties which will be added to the collection, or an Array of values, each of which are added to the collection.

method.name: each
method.description:
Executes the specified function once for every item in the collection, passing the following arguments:
  • item : Mixed

    The collection item

  • index : Number

    The item's index

  • length : Number

    The total number of items in the collection

The function should return a boolean value. Returning false from the function will stop the iteration.

parameter.name: fn
parameter.description: The function to execute for each item.

parameter.name: scope
parameter.description: (optional) The scope in which to execute the function.

method.name: eachKey
method.description: Executes the specified function once for every key in the collection, passing each key, and its associated item as the first two parameters.

parameter.name: fn
parameter.description: The function to execute for each item.

parameter.name: scope
parameter.description: (optional) The scope in which to execute the function.

method.name: find
method.description: Returns the first item in the collection which elicits a true return value from the passed selection function.

parameter.name: fn
parameter.description: The selection function to execute for each item.

parameter.name: scope
parameter.description: (optional) The scope in which to execute the function.

method.name: insert
method.description: Inserts an item at the specified index in the collection. Fires the add event when complete.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: The index to insert the item at.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: The key to associate with the new item, or the item itself.

parameter.name: o
parameter.description: (optional) If the second parameter was a key, the new item.

method.name: remove
method.description: Remove an item from the collection.

parameter.name: o
parameter.description: The item to remove.

method.name: removeAt
method.description: Remove an item from a specified index in the collection. Fires the remove event when complete.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: The index within the collection of the item to remove.

method.name: removeKey
method.description: Removed an item associated with the passed key fom the collection.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: The key of the item to remove.

method.name: getCount
method.description: Returns the number of items in the collection.

method.name: indexOf
method.description: Returns index within the collection of the passed Object.

parameter.name: o
parameter.description: The item to find the index of.

method.name: indexOfKey
method.description: Returns index within the collection of the passed key.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: The key to find the index of.

method.name: item
method.description: Returns the item associated with the passed key OR index. Key has priority over index. This is the equivalent of calling key first, then if nothing matched calling itemAt.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: The key or index of the item.

method.name: itemAt
method.description: Returns the item at the specified index.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: The index of the item.

method.name: key
method.description: Returns the item associated with the passed key.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: The key of the item.

method.name: contains
method.description: Returns true if the collection contains the passed Object as an item.

parameter.name: o
parameter.description: The Object to look for in the collection.

method.name: containsKey
method.description: Returns true if the collection contains the passed Object as a key.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: The key to look for in the collection.

method.name: clear
method.description: Removes all items from the collection. Fires the clear event when complete.

method.name: first
method.description: Returns the first item in the collection.

method.name: last
method.description: Returns the last item in the collection.

method.name: sort
method.description: Sorts this collection with the passed comparison function

parameter.name: direction
parameter.description: (optional) "ASC" or "DESC"

parameter.name: fn
parameter.description: (optional) comparison function

method.name: keySort
method.description: Sorts this collection by keys

parameter.name: direction
parameter.description: (optional) "ASC" or "DESC"

parameter.name: fn
parameter.description: (optional) a comparison function (defaults to case insensitive string)

method.name: getRange
method.description: Returns a range of items in this collection

parameter.name: startIndex
parameter.description: (optional) defaults to 0

parameter.name: endIndex
parameter.description: (optional) default to the last item

method.name: filter
method.description: Filter the objects in this collection by a specific property. Returns a new collection that has been filtered.

parameter.name: property
parameter.description: A property on your objects

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: Either string that the property values should start with or a RegExp to test against the property

parameter.name: anyMatch
parameter.description: (optional) True to match any part of the string, not just the beginning

parameter.name: caseSensitive
parameter.description: (optional) True for case sensitive comparison (defaults to False).

method.name: filterBy
method.description: Filter by a function. Returns a new collection that has been filtered. The passed function will be called with each object in the collection. If the function returns true, the value is included otherwise it is filtered.

parameter.name: fn
parameter.description: The function to be called, it will receive the args o (the object), k (the key)

parameter.name: scope
parameter.description: (optional) The scope of the function (defaults to this)

method.name: findIndex
method.description: Finds the index of the first matching object in this collection by a specific property/value.

parameter.name: property
parameter.description: The name of a property on your objects.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: A string that the property values should start with or a RegExp to test against the property.

parameter.name: start
parameter.description: (optional) The index to start searching at (defaults to 0).

parameter.name: anyMatch
parameter.description: (optional) True to match any part of the string, not just the beginning.

parameter.name: caseSensitive
parameter.description: (optional) True for case sensitive comparison.

method.name: findIndexBy
method.description: Find the index of the first matching object in this collection by a function. If the function returns true it is considered a match.

parameter.name: fn
parameter.description: The function to be called, it will receive the args o (the object), k (the key).

parameter.name: scope
parameter.description: (optional) The scope of the function (defaults to this).

parameter.name: start
parameter.description: (optional) The index to start searching at (defaults to 0).

method.name: clone
method.description: Creates a duplicate of this collection

method.name: get
method.description: Returns the item associated with the passed key or index.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: The key or index of the item.

method.name: fireEvent
method.description: Fires the specified event with the passed parameters (minus the event name).

parameter.name: args
parameter.description: Variable number of parameters are passed to handlers

method.name: addListener
method.description: Appends an event handler to this component

parameter.name: eventName
parameter.description: The type of event to listen for

parameter.name: handler
parameter.description: The method the event invokes

parameter.name: scope
parameter.description: (optional) The scope in which to execute the handler function. The handler function's "this" context.

parameter.name: options

method.name: removeListener
method.description: Removes a listener

parameter.name: eventName
parameter.description: The type of event to listen for

parameter.name: handler
parameter.description: The handler to remove

parameter.name: scope
parameter.description: (optional) The scope (this object) for the handler

method.name: purgeListeners
method.description: Removes all listeners for this object

method.name: relayEvents
method.description: Relays selected events from the specified Observable as if the events were fired by this.

parameter.name: o
parameter.description: The Observable whose events this object is to relay.

parameter.name: events
parameter.description: Array of event names to relay.

method.name: addEvents
method.description: Used to define events on this Observable

parameter.name: object
parameter.description: The object with the events defined

method.name: hasListener
method.description: Checks to see if this object has any listeners for a specified event

parameter.name: eventName
parameter.description: The name of the event to check for

method.name: suspendEvents
method.description: Suspend the firing of all events. (see resumeEvents)

method.name: resumeEvents
method.description: Resume firing events. (see suspendEvents)

method.name: on
method.description: Appends an event handler to this element (shorthand for addListener)

parameter.name: eventName
parameter.description: The type of event to listen for

parameter.name: handler
parameter.description: The method the event invokes

parameter.name: scope
parameter.description: (optional) The scope in which to execute the handler function. The handler function's "this" context.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description: (optional)

method.name: un
method.description: Removes a listener (shorthand for removeListener)

parameter.name: eventName
parameter.description: The type of event to listen for

parameter.name: handler
parameter.description: The handler to remove

parameter.name: scope
parameter.description: (optional) The scope (this object) for the handler

method.name: Observable.capture
method.description: <static> Starts capture on the specified Observable. All events will be passed to the supplied function with the event name + standard signature of the event before the event is fired. If the supplied function returns false, the event will not fire.

parameter.name: o
parameter.description: The Observable to capture

parameter.name: fn
parameter.description: The function to call

parameter.name: scope
parameter.description: (optional) The scope (this object) for the fn

method.name: Observable.releaseCapture
method.description: <static> Removes all added captures from the Observable.

parameter.name: o
parameter.description: The Observable to release

parameter.name: interval
parameter.description: (optional) The minimum precision in milliseconds supported by this TaskRunner instance (defaults to 10)

method.name: start
method.description: Starts a new task.

parameter.name: task
parameter.description:
A config object that supports the following properties:
  • run : Function
    The function to execute each time the task is run. The function will be called at each interval and passed the args argument if specified. If a particular scope is required, be sure to specify it using the scope argument.
  • interval : Number
    The frequency in milliseconds with which the task should be executed.
  • args : Array
    (optional) An array of arguments to be passed to the function specified by run.
  • scope : Object
    (optional) The scope in which to execute the run function.
  • duration : Number
    (optional) The length of time in milliseconds to execute the task before stopping automatically (defaults to indefinite).
  • repeat : Number
    (optional) The number of times to execute the task before stopping automatically (defaults to indefinite).

method.name: stop
method.description: Stops an existing running task.

parameter.name: task
parameter.description: The task to stop

method.name: stopAll
method.description: Stops all tasks that are currently running.

class.description:
Provides precise pixel measurements for blocks of text so that you can determine exactly how high and wide, in pixels, a given block of text will be.

This class is a singleton and cannot be created directly.

method.name: measure
method.description: Measures the size of the specified text

parameter.name: el
parameter.description: The element, dom node or id from which to copy existing CSS styles that can affect the size of the rendered text

parameter.name: text
parameter.description: The text to measure

parameter.name: fixedWidth
parameter.description: (optional) If the text will be multiline, you have to set a fixed width in order to accurately measure the text height

method.name: createInstance
method.description: Return a unique TextMetrics instance that can be bound directly to an element and reused. This reduces the overhead of multiple calls to initialize the style properties on each measurement.

parameter.name: el
parameter.description: The element, dom node or id that the instance will be bound to

parameter.name: fixedWidth
parameter.description: (optional) If the text will be multiline, you have to set a fixed width in order to accurately measure the text height

method.name: getSize
method.description: Returns the size of the specified text based on the internal element's style and width properties

parameter.name: text
parameter.description: The text to measure

method.name: bind
method.description: Binds this TextMetrics instance to an element from which to copy existing CSS styles that can affect the size of the rendered text

parameter.name: el
parameter.description: The element, dom node or id

method.name: setFixedWidth
method.description: Sets a fixed width on the internal measurement element. If the text will be multiline, you have to set a fixed width in order to accurately measure the text height.

parameter.name: width
parameter.description: The width to set on the element

method.name: getWidth
method.description: Returns the measured width of the specified text

parameter.name: text
parameter.description: The text to measure

method.name: getHeight
method.description: Returns the measured height of the specified text. For multiline text, be sure to call setFixedWidth if necessary.

parameter.name: text
parameter.description: The text to measure

class.description: These functions are available on every Function object (any JavaScript function).

method.name: createCallback
createDelegate

parameter.name: obj
parameter.description: (optional) The object for which the scope is set

parameter.name: args
parameter.description: (optional) Overrides arguments for the call. (Defaults to the arguments passed by the caller)

parameter.name: appendArgs
parameter.description: (optional) if True args are appended to call args instead of overriding, if a number the args are inserted at the specified position

method.name: defer

parameter.name: millis
parameter.description: The number of milliseconds for the setTimeout call (if 0 the function is executed immediately)

parameter.name: obj
parameter.description: (optional) The object for which the scope is set

parameter.name: args
parameter.description: (optional) Overrides arguments for the call. (Defaults to the arguments passed by the caller)

parameter.name: appendArgs
parameter.description: (optional) if True args are appended to call args instead of overriding, if a number the args are inserted at the specified position

method.name: createSequence

parameter.name: fcn
parameter.description: The function to sequence

parameter.name: scope
parameter.description: (optional) The scope of the passed fcn (Defaults to scope of original function or window)

method.name: createInterceptor

parameter.name: fcn
parameter.description: The function to call before the original

parameter.name: scope
parameter.description: (optional) The scope of the passed fcn (Defaults to scope of original function or window)

method.name: constrain
method.description: Checks whether or not the current number is within a desired range. If the number is already within the range it is returned, otherwise the min or max value is returned depending on which side of the range is exceeded. Note that this method returns the constrained value but does not change the current number.

parameter.name: min
parameter.description: The minimum number in the range

parameter.name: max
parameter.description: The maximum number in the range

class.description: These functions are available as static methods on the JavaScript String object.

method.name: escape
method.description: <static> Escapes the passed string for ' and \

parameter.name: string
parameter.description: The string to escape

method.name: leftPad

parameter.name: string
parameter.description: The original string

parameter.name: size
parameter.description: The total length of the output string

parameter.name: char
parameter.description: (optional) The character with which to pad the original string (defaults to empty string " ")

method.name: format

parameter.name: string
parameter.description: The tokenized string to be formatted

parameter.name: value1
parameter.description: The value to replace token {0}

parameter.name: value2
parameter.description: Etc...

method.name: toggle
method.description:
Utility function that allows you to easily switch a string between two alternating values. The passed value is compared to the current string, and if they are equal, the other value that was passed in is returned. If they are already different, the first value passed in is returned. Note that this method returns the new value but does not change the current string. 
// alternate sort directions
sort = sort.toggle('ASC', 'DESC');

// instead of conditional logic:
sort = (sort == 'ASC' ? 'DESC' : 'ASC');

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The value to compare to the current string

parameter.name: other
parameter.description: The new value to use if the string already equals the first value passed in

method.name: trim
method.description:
Trims whitespace from either end of a string, leaving spaces within the string intact. Example: 
var s = '  foo bar  ';
alert('-' + s + '-');         //alerts "- foo bar -"
alert('-' + s.trim() + '-');  //alerts "-foo bar-"
